recipe_ingredients:
0: 3 - 3 1/2 pounds  boneless beef chuck pot roast
1: Salt
2: Ground black pepper
3: 2  tablespoons  olive oil or vegetable oil
4: 1  14  ounce can beef broth
5: 1   chopped onion (1 large)
6: 2   stalks celery, cut into 2-inch lengths
7: 5  cups  assorted vegetables, such as peeled Yukon gold or sweet potatoes, cut into 2-inch chunks; parsnips, peeled and cut into 2-inch chunks; whole shallots or garlic bulbs, halved horizontally; and/or small carrots, peeled and cut into 1-1/2-inch pieces
8: 1/4 cup  cold water
9: 3  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Trim fat from meat. Sprinkle meat with salt and pepper. In a large Dutch oven brown roast on all sides in hot oil over medium heat. Carefully drain fat from pan; discard. Add beef broth, onion, and celery to pan.
1: Roast, covered, for 1-1/4 hours. Remove celery with slotted spoon; discard. Add desired vegetables around roast. Roast, uncovered, for 50 to 60 minutes more or until meat and vegetables are tender, spooning juices twice during roasting.
2: Using a slotted spoon, remove meat and vegetables to a serving platter. For gravy, measure pan juices; skim off any fat. Discard enough pan juice or add enough water to equal 1-1/2 cups. In a medium saucepan whisk together the cold water and the flour until well combined; add the 1-1/2 cups pan juices. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly; cook and stir for 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper. Pass gravy with meat and vegetables.
recipe_description: An oven or slow cooker turns an inexpensive beef pot roast into a succulent, tender feast. Vegetables cooked with the roast make for a simple, but filling meal.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 8  sheets frozen phyllo dough (18x14-inch rectangles), thawed
2: 1/2  of a small red onion, chopped (about 1/3 cup)
3: 3   cloves garlic, minced
4: 1  tablespoon  olive oil or canola oil
5: 8  ounces  shiitake*, oyster*, or button mushrooms, sliced
6: 12  ounces  boneless beef top sirloin steak, cut into thin bite-size strips
7: 1/4 cup  snipped fresh mixed herbs such as tarragon, rosemary, basil, oregano, and/or parsley or 1 tablespoon dried herbs, such as tarragon, rosemary, basil, oregano and/or parsley, crushed
8: 1/4 teaspoon  cracked black pepper
9: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
10: 3/4 cup  shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese (3 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 375 degrees  F. Lightly coat a large baking sheet with nonstick spray. Place one phyllo sheet on baking sheet. Lightly coat phyllo with nonstick spray. Top with second sheet; lightly coat with nonstick spray. Repeat with remaining phyllo sheets. Roll up phyllo edges to form a rim. Bake for 15 minutes.
1: Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook onion and garlic in hot oil over medium-high heat for 2 minutes. Add mushrooms. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and liquid has evaporated, stirring occasionally. Remove mixture from skillet and set aside.
2: In the same skillet cook steak for 2 to 3 minutes until meat is slightly pink in the center, stirring occasionally. Stir in herbs and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Remove from heat.
3: Top phyllo with the meat mixture, mushroom mixture, and the cheese. Bake for 10 minutes more or until phyllo is golden brown and cheese is melted.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  packed brown sugar or 1/4 cup maple-flavored syrup
1: 1/2 cup  bottled hot-style barbecue sauce, chili sauce or ketchup
2: 1/2 cup  bottled chipotle salsa, hot picante sauce or salsa
3: 1/4 cup  molasses or sorghum
4: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh oregano or 1 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed
5: 1 1/2 teaspoons  dry mustard
6: 1 1/2 teaspoons  ground cumin or chili powder
7: 1  31  ounce can pork and beans in tomato sauce
8: 1  16  ounce can pinto, cannellini, Great Northern, black or butter beans, rinsed and drained
9: 1  16  ounce can red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
10: 1  large onion, finely chopped
11: 8  slices thick-cut bacon, crisp cooked and cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 cup finely chopped purchased or leftover cooked beef brisket, 12 ounces bulk pork sausage or ground beef, cooked and drained
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl, combine brown sugar, barbecue sauce, salsa, molasses, oregano, mustard and cumin. Add undrained pork and beans, drained pinto beans, drained kidney beans, onion and bacon; stir gently to combine.
1: Transfer bean mixture to a 2-1/2- to 3-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, in a 325 degree F oven for 2-1/2 to 3 hours or until desired consistency, stirring occasionally. Beans will thicken as they cool. Makes 12 side-dish servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2   large onions, cut into 1/2-inch wedges (2 cups)
1: 1  3 - 3 1/2 pound  boneless beef chuck pot roast, cut into 1-inch cubes
2: 3/4 cup  dry red wine or lower-sodium beef broth
3: 1/4 cup  tomato paste
4: 3  tablespoons  balsamic vinegar or cider
5: 2  3  inches  cinnamon sticks
6: 1  teaspoon  dried rosemary, crushed
7: 1  teaspoon  ground allspice
8: 3/4 teaspoon  salt
9: 1/4- 1/2 teaspoon  crushed red pepper
10: 1  2  pound  butternut squash, peeled, seeded and cut into 1-1/2-inch pieces (about 4 1/2 cups)
11: 2   large quince or cooking apples, cored and cut into 1/2-inch wedges
12: 4  cups  hot cooked couscous
recipe_instructions:
0: Place onions in a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker. Place beef on top of onions. In a bowl combine wine, tomato paste, vinegar, cinnamon, rosemary, allspice, salt, and crushed red pepper; pour over beef.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 hours or on high-heat setting for 3 hours. Adjust low-heat setting to high-heat setting. Stir in squash and quince. Cover and cook 1-1/2 to 2 hours more or until squash is tender. If using apples, add to cooker the last 1/2 hour of cooking. Remove and discard cinnamon. Serve pot roast with couscous and juices. Makes 8 servings.
recipe_description: When layering ingredients in a slow cooker, put denser vegetables, such as squash, beneath more tender ones.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 5  pounds  beef short ribs
1: 1  14  ounce can beef broth
2: 1  12  ounce can dark beer
3: 1  medium onion, cut into thin wedges
4: 1/4 cup  molasses
5: 2  tablespoons  balsamic vinegar
6: 1  teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
7: 1  teaspoon  bottled hot pepper sauce
8: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
9: Mashed potatoes or hot buttered noodles (optional)
10: Fresh thyme leaves (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Place ribs in a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker. Add broth, beer, onion, molasses, vinegar, thyme, hot pepper sauce, and salt.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 11 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 5-1/2 to 6 hours.
2: Using a slottled spoon, transfer ribs to platter; cover to keep warm. Skim fat from cooking liquid. If desired, serve with mashed potatoes and garnish with fresh thyme leaves. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  3  pound  beef chuck roast
1: 1  pound  small whole carrots, cut in 2 inch pieces (halve any large)
2: 8  ounces  boiling onions, peeled and halved, or 1 large onion cut in thin wedges
3: 4  cloves garlic, halved
4: 2   jalapeno peppers*, seeded and sliced
5: 1  cup  strong brewed coffee
6: 1  15  ounce envelope beef stew seasoning mix
7: 2  tablespoons  balsamic vinegar
8: 2  cubes chipotle bouillon cubes, crumbled; or 2 beef bouillon cubes, crumbled with 1/2 tsp. ground chipotle chile
9: 1   bay leaf
10: 1  8  ounce container dairy sour cream
11: 1  recipe Gremolata (recipe below)
12: 1  tablespoon  finely shredded lemon peel
13: 1/4 cup  snipped Italian (flat-leaf) parsley
14: 1   clove finely chopped garlic
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from roast; sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper on meat. Set aside.
1: In 6-quart slow cooker combine carrots, onions, garlic and jalapeno peppers. Place roast on top of vegetables.
2: In medium bowl combine coffee, seasoning mix, balsamic vinegar,  bouillon, and  bay leaf. Pour over roast in cooker.
3: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 9 to 10 hours.
4: Transfer roast to cutting board; cover and let rest 10 minutes. With slotted spoon, transfer vegetables to serving dishes (remove and discard bay leaf); cut up meat and add to bowls. Using a wire mesh strainer, strain sauce, reserving 2 cups. Place sour cream in a medium bowl; whisk in the 2 cups sauce. Spoon some sauce on beef; pass remaining. Sprinkle with Gremolata. Makes 8 servings.
5: In a small bowl combine lemon peel, parsley, and garlic.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  2 1/2- 3  pound  corned beef brisket
1: 1  7  ounce package mixed dried fruit
2: 1/2 cup  dried cranberries
3: 2  tablespoons  quick-cooking tapioca
4: 1/2 cup  orange juice
5: 1/2 cup  water
6: 1  tablespoon  mild-flavored molasses
7: 1/4 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
8: 1/8 teaspoon  ground nutmeg
recipe_name: Orange-Spiced Corned Beef with Dried Fruit
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from meat. If necessary, cut meat to fit into a 3-1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker. If a seasoning packet is present, discard it. Place meat in the cooker.
1: Cut any large pieces of mixed dried fruit into quarters. Sprinkle mixed dried fruit, dried cranberries, and tapioca over meat in cooker. In a small bowl, combine orange juice, the water, molasses, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Pour over mixture in cooker.
2: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 8 to 10 hours or on high-heat setting for 4 to 5 hours.
3: Remove meat from cooker. Thinly slice meat across the grain. Arrange meat slices on a serving platter. Spoon fruit mixture over meat. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Mixed dried fruit, orange juice, molasses, and spices dress up plain-Jane corned beef with lively new flavor in this main-dish recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  beef broth
1: 2  tablespoons  flour
2: 2 1/2 cups  shredded pot roast (about 9 ounces)
3: 1  10  ounce box frozen peas and carrots, thawed
4: 1/2 teaspoon  dried oregano
5: 1  21  ounce package prepared mashed potatoes (such as Country Crock)
6: Paprika, for sprinkling
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a 1-1/2-quart casserole with nonstick cooking spray. Whisk beef broth and flour together in a medium-size saucepan. Heat until simmering, about 4 minutes; simmer 1 minute or until thickened.
1: Stir in pot roast, thawed peas and carrots, and oregano. Spoon mixture into prepared casserole.
2: Heat potatoes as per package directions. Spoon over top of meat mixture; sprinkle potatoes with a little paprika. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.
recipe_description: This classic casserole recipe is a quick and easy way to turn leftover roast beef into a delicious dinner. Unused mashed potatoes can also be substituted for the packaged variety.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3/4 pound  lean ground beef
1: 1   medium onion, peeled and chopped
2: 1   medium zucchini (about 6 ounces), shredded
3: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
5: 1  cup  shredded Italian cheese blend
6: 1/2 cup  heart-healthy reduced-fat biscuit mix (such as Bisquick)
7: 1  cup  milk
8: 2   eggs
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a 9-inch pie plate with nonstick cooking spray.
1: Spray a large nonstick skillet with nonstick cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat. Crumble in ground beef. Stir in onion and zucchini and cook for 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper.
2: Spread beef mixture into the prepared 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle the cheese over the top.
3: In a medium-size bowl, whisk together the biscuit mix, milk and eggs until smooth. Pour mixture over beef mixture.
4: Bake at 400 degrees  for 25 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow to cool for 5 to 10 minutes. Cut into 6 wedges and serve with a green salad, if desired.
recipe_description: The flaky crust for this tasty pie recipe forms at the top. A beef and zucchini mixture followed by a layer of Italian cheeses make the delicious filling underneath.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 1  1  pound loaf frozen whole wheat bread dough, thawed
2: 12  ounces  lean ground beef
3: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
4: 1/2 cup  bottled salsa
5: 1 1/2 cups  chopped tomatoes
6: 1/2 cup  shredded reduced-fat cheddar cheese (2 ounces)
7: 1/2- 1  cup  shredded lettuce and/or spinach
8: 1  cup  baked tortilla chips, coarsely crushed
9: 1/4 cup  light sour cream
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Lightly coat a 12- to 13-inch pizza pan with cooking spray. Pat dough evenly into prepared pan, building up edges slightly. (If dough is hard to pat out, allow to rest for 10 minutes.) Prick crust all over with a fork. Bake for 12 minutes.
1: Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook the ground beef and onion until meat is brown and onion is tender, stirring to break up meat as it cooks. Drain off fat. Stir in the salsa. Top partially baked crust with meat mixture. Bake for 5 minutes more. Sprinkle with tomatoes and cheese. Bake for 2 to 3 minutes more or until cheese melts.
2: To serve, top with lettuce and tortilla chips. Serve with sour cream. Makes 8 servings (1 slice each)

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  large onion, sliced
1: 1  tablespoon  vegetable oil
2: 2  cups  Shredded Beef Master Recipe
3: 1  14 1/2 ounce can no-salt-added diced tomatoes, undrained
4: 1   fresh jalapeno chile pepper, seeded and finely chopped*
5: 1  teaspoon  ground cumin
6: 1  teaspoon  chili powder
7: 1  tablespoon  chopped fresh cilantro
8: 1  cup  shredded lettuce
9: 4   whole wheat hamburger buns, split and toasted, if desired
10: 1/2 cup  shredded reduced-fat cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese (2 ounces)
11: 3 - 3 1/2 pounds  boneless beef chuck pot roast
12: 2  large onions, cut into thin wedges
13: 2  cloves garlic, minced
14: 1  14  ounce can lower-sodium beef broth
15: 1  tablespoon  Worcestershire sauce
16: 2  teaspoons  dry mustard
17: 1  teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
18: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
19: 1/4 teaspoon  cayenne pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large saucepan cook onion in hot oil over medium heat about 4 minutes or until tender. Add shredded beef, tomatoes, jalapeno, cumin, and chili powder. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, about 5 minutes or until heated through and desired consistency. Stir in cilantro.
1: To serve, divide lettuce among bun bottoms. Spoon about 1/2 cup meat mixture over lettuce on each bun. Sprinkle with cheese. Add bun tops.
2: Trim fat from meat. If necessary, cut meat to fit a 4- to 5-quart slow cooker. Place onions and garlic in the cooker. Top with meat. In a medium bowl, combine broth, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, thyme, salt, and cayenne pepper. Pour over meat in cooker.
3: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 11 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 5 1/2 to 6 hours. Remove meat from cooker; remove onion with a slotted spoon, reserving juices. Using two forks, shred meat, discarding any fat. Skim fat from juices. Add onion to meat; add enough juices to the meat to moisten. Place 2-cup portions of beef in airtight containers and refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 15  ounce can (3/4 cup) black beans, drained and rinsed
1: 2/3 cup  corn relish
2: 1/4 cup  halved and thinly sliced radishes
3: 1  small fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
4: 2  teaspoons  lime juice
5: 1/4 teaspoon  ground cumin
6: 1  ounce  beef flank steak
7: Salt and black pepper
8: Fresh rosemary (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: For relish, in a small bowl combine drained black beans, corn relish, radishes, jalapeno pepper, lime juice, and cumin. Cover; chill at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.
1: Trim fat from steak. Score both sides of steak in a diamond pattern by making shallow diagonal cuts at 1-inch intervals. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place steak on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat for 12 to 14 minutes or to desired doneness, turning once. (Or, grill steak on the rack of an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 12 to 14 minutes, turning once.)
2: To serve, thinly slice steak diagonally across the grain. Serve with relish. If desired, garnish with rosemary. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Sizzling steak on the grill is irresistible. Top it with vibrant bean and corn relish and you'll have diners dashing to dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   slightly beaten egg
1: 3/4 cup  soft bread crumbs (1 slice bread)
2: 3/4 cup  salsa
3: 1/3 cup  raisins
4: 1/4 cup  finely chopped almonds, toasted
5: 1/4 cup  finely chopped onion
6: 1/2 teaspoon  sugar
7: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
8: 1/4 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
9: 1/8 teaspoon  ground cloves
10: 1 1/2 pounds  lean ground beef
11: 1/4 cup  salsa
12: Salsa (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl stir together the egg, bread crumbs, the 3/4 cup salsa, the raisins, almonds, onion, sugar, salt, cinnamon, and cloves. Add ground beef; mix well. In a shallow baking pan pat meat mixture into an 8x4x2-inch oval loaf. (Or, pat meat mixture into an 8x4x2-inch loaf pan.) Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 1 hour.
1: Drain off fat. Insert a meat thermometer into center of loaf. Spoon the 1/4 cup salsa over meat loaf. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes more or until thermometer registers 160 degree F. Transfer meat loaf to a serving platter. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
2: To serve, slice meat loaf with a thin-bladed serrated knife. If desired, serve meat loaf with additional salsa. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: For a meat loaf that is different from your usual recipe, try this version made with salsa, raisins, spices, and almonds.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  teaspoon  garlic powder
1: 1/2 teaspoon  paprika
2: 1/2 teaspoon  cumin seeds, crushed
3: 1  1 1/4- 1 1/2 pound  beef flank steak, about 3/4 inch thick
4: 1  cup  lightly packed parsley leaves
5: 1/3 cup  olive oil
6: 2  tablespoons  sherry wine vinegar or red wine vinegar
7: 2  tablespoons  lemon juice
8: 1  tablespoon  finely chopped shallot or onion
9: 2 - 3   cloves garlic, minced
10: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
11: 1/4 teaspoon  freshly ground black pepper
12: 1/4 teaspoon  crushed red pepper
13: Coarse kosher salt
14: 1  12 - 16  ounce  loaf baguette-style French bread, cut into 1/2-inch slices
15: Fleur de sel (French sea salt) (optional)
16: Snipped fresh parsley (optional)
recipe_name: Grilled Flank Steak with Chimichurri Sauce
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small bowl, combine garlic powder, paprika, and cumin. Set aside.
1: Trim fat from steak. Score both sides of steak in a diamond pattern by making shallow diagonal cuts at 1-inch intervals. Press dry rub onto both sides of steak. Cover steak with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator for 3 to 6 hours. Meanwhile, make Chimichurri sauce.
2: In a blender or food processor, combine parsley, oil, vinegar, lemon juice, shallot, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and red pepper. Cover and pulse until well chopped, but not pureed. Set aside.
3: Season steak with kosher salt. For a charcoal grill, grill steak on the rack of an uncovered grill directly over medium coals until desired doneness, turning halfway through grilling. Allow 17 to 21 minutes for medium doneness (160 degree F). (For a gas grill, preheat grill. Reduce heat to medium. Place steak on grill rack over heat. Cover and grill as above.)
4: To serve, brush baguette slices on one side with some of the Chimichurri sauce; set aside. Thinly slice steak diagonally across the grain, cutting long slices in half. Place one or two slices on each piece of bread; spoon additional Chimichurri sauce over meat. If you like, sprinkle with a pinch of fleur de sel and garnish with parsley. Serve warm. Makes 16 to 18 appetizer- or 6 to 8 main-dish servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Mashed Potatoes*
1: 1 1/4 pounds  lean ground beef
2: 1/2 cup  chopped onion (1 medium)
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: Dash black pepper
5: 2 1/2 cups  frozen cut green beans, thawed
6: 1  10 3/4 ounce can condensed tomato soup
7: 1/2 cup  shredded process American cheese (2 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Prepare Mashed Potatoes*; set aside. In a large skillet cook meat and onion until meat is brown and onion is tender. Drain off fat. Add the salt and pepper. Stir in thawed beans and soup; pour into a greased 2-quart rectangular baking dish or casserole.
1: Spoon Mashed Potatoes in mounds on bean mixture (or, if desired, pipe potatoes using a pastry bag and a large star tip). Sprinkle cheese over the potatoes. Bake, uncovered, in a 350 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until mixture is bubbly and cheese begins to brown. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Beef, green beans, and potatoes come together in a savory pie that is sure to satisfy the whole family.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  ground sirloin
1: 1  pound  ground chuck
2: 1 1/2 teaspoons  kosher salt
3: 1/2 teaspoon  freshly ground pepper
4: 6   hamburger buns
5: 1   shallot, grated
6: 1  8  ounce  block sharp cheddar cheese, grated
7: 1/2 cup  or more to taste of mayonnaise (not light)
8: 1/2 4  ounce jar pimientos
9: Freshly ground pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Build charcoal fire or preheat gas grill for direct cooking. Mix ground sirloin and chuck together gently with salt and pepper. Form into 6 patties. Press indentation in center of each patty (see "shaping the burgers," below). Brush with olive oil. Place directly over medium heat (about 400 degrees F); grill 10 to 12 minutes, turning once halfway through. Remove from grill. Top with a tablespoonful of Pimiento Cheese. Serve on buns.
1: Grate shallot on a box grater or process in a food processor. Mix shallot and cheese. Add mayo and stir with a large fork just until mixture holds together. Stir in pimientos and some of their liquid. Season with pepper. Refrigerate, covered, until ready to use. Store, refrigerated, up to a week.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  sliced bacon
1: 1  pound  ground beef
2: 2   red and/or green sweet peppers, chopped
3: 1  large red onion, chopped
4: 1 1/2 cups  whiskey
5: 2  15 - 16  ounce cans red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
6: 2  12  ounce cans or bottles dark beer
7: 3  cups  beef broth
8: 1/2- 1  11  ounce can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, snipped
9: 1  6  ounce can tomato paste
10: 1/4 cup  packed brown sugar
11: 3  tablespoons  liquid smoke
12: 3  tablespoons  bottled hot sauce (such as Frank's, Da Bomb, or Texas Pete)
13: 1  teaspoon  chili powder
14: 1  teaspoon  packaged seasoning mix for chili
15: Diced or shredded cheddar cheese, tortilla chips, and/or sour cream (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 6-quart pot, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp; drain on paper towels (cook in batches, if necessary). Discard bacon dripppings. Chop bacon and return to pot. Add ground beef, sweet peppers and onion to pot and cook until beef is browned and peppers and onion are tender. Drain fat. Remove beef mixture from pot.
1: Remove pot from heat. Add whiskey to pot, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Return pot to heat. Bring whiskey to boiling and simmer, uncovered, about 5 minutes or until whiskey is reduced slightly. Add bacon and beef mixture back to pot. Add beans, beer, broth, chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, tomato paste, brown sugar, liquid smoke, hot sauce, chili powder and seasoning for chili. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 3 hours, stirring occasionally.
2: Serve with cheddar cheese, tortilla chips, and or sour cream, if you like.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  White Lily flour
1: 1 1/2 teaspoons  baking powder
2: 1  teaspoon  baking soda
3: 2   large eggs
4: 1 1/2- 2 1/2 cups  whole buttermilk
5: 5  tablespoons  unsalted butter, melted
6: 3/4 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
7: 3/4 cup  grated Gruyere cheese
8: 1  teaspoon  sugar
9: Pinch of coarse salt
10: Freshly ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Sift together flour, baking powder, and baking soda three times; set aside.
1: In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, 1 1/2 cups buttermilk, and butter until well combined. Add flour mixture and whisk until smooth. Batter should have a pudding-like consistency. If necessary, add more buttermilk, 1/4 cup at a time, until pudding-like consistency is reached. Stir in cheese, sugar, and salt; season with pepper.
2: Preheat a waffle iron. Add 1/4 to 1/2 cup batter to heated waffle iron; close and cook until dark golden brown, 5 to 6 minutes, depending on your waffle iron. Repeat process with remaining batter and serve immediately.
recipe_description: Two types of cheeses and rich buttermilk add a tangy and sweet flavor kick to basic waffles in this recipe from Linton Hopkins of Restaurant Eugene in Atlanta. Serve them with his homemade Tomato Soup.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 cups  fresh or frozen cranberries
1: 2 1/2 cups  all-purpose flour
2: 1  cup  sugar
3: 1  tablespoon  baking powder
4: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
5: 2   eggs
6: 1  cup  buttermilk
7: 1/3 cup  butter, melted
8: 1 - 1 1/2 teaspoons  almond extract
9: 2/3 cup  chopped almonds, toasted if you like
10: 1/4 cup  white baking pieces
11: 3  tablespoons  powdered sugar
12: 1  tablespoon  French vanilla liquid coffee creamer
recipe_name: Almond-Cranberry Bread with White Chocolate Glaze
recipe_instructions:
0: Rinse cranberries in cold water; drain. Grease bottom and 1/2 inch up the sides of one 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Line bottom of pan with waxed paper; grease. Set aside.
1: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Make a well in center of flour mixture; set aside.
2: In a medium bowl, combine eggs, buttermilk, melted butter and almond extract. Add egg mixture all at once to flour mixture. Stir just until moistened (batter should be lumpy). Fold in cranberries and the chopped almonds. Spoon batter into prepared pan, spreading evenly.
3: Bake in a 325 degrees  oven about 1 hour 15 minutes or until a wooden skewer inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Wrap and store overnight before slicing.
4: Before serving, unwrap bread. Drizzle with White Chocolate Glaze and, if desired, sprinkle with additional toasted almonds. Makes 1 loaf (12 slices).
5: In a small, microwave-safe bowl, microwave white baking pieces on 50 percent power (medium) for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes or until melted and smooth, stirring once or twice. Stir in powdered sugar and French vanilla liquid coffee creamer. If necessary, stir in additional coffee creamer, 1 teaspoon at a time, until glaze reaches drizzling consistency. Makes 1/4 cup.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  all-purpose flour
1: 1 1/2 teaspoons  baking powder
2: 1/2 teaspoon  baking soda
3: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/4 cup  cold butter
5: 1/2 cup  milk
6: 1/2 cup  dairy sour cream
recipe_instructions:
0: Turn on oven to 400 degree F. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Using a pastry blender, cut butter into dry ingredients until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. (Or, crumble the butter in with your fingers.)
1: In a small bowl, stir together milk and sour cream until mixture is almost smooth. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture. Add the milk mixture all at once. Using a wooden spoon stir just until the dough sticks together.
2: Using hands or wooden spoon, push dough onto a lightly floured surface. Sprinkle a little flour on hands. Gently knead 8 or 10 times or just until dough holds together.
3: Pat dough to 1/2-inch thickness. (Or, roll dough with a floured rolling pin.) Using the edge of a clean, floured ruler, cut dough into large diamonds or squares, approximately 3 inches. Place on ungreased baking sheet, leaving a 1-inch space between each biscuit.
4: Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Using a wide spatula, carefully remove biscuits from baking sheet. Serve immediately.  Makes 12 biscuits.
5: You will need an adult helper.
recipe_description: Kids can help make and form these simple biscuits. They go well with soup, salad, or a casserole.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  cups  all-purpose flour, plus additional for kneading
1: 2  tablespoons  baking powder
2: 1 1/4 tablespoons  salt
3: 1  stick (1/2 cup) cold unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
4: 2  cups  (6 oz.) grated cheddar
5: 1/2 cup  chopped fresh chives
6: 2  cups  heavy cream, plus additional for brushing biscuits
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degree F and arrange rack in center. Lightly grease 2 large cookie sheets.
1: Whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. Add butter and, using fingertips, rub into flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Using a fork, stir in cheddar and chives until combined well. Using fork, stir in cream. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead about 8 times, until it just holds together. Pat into a 1/2-inch-thick round, 12 inches in diameter. Using a 2-1/2-inch biscuit or flower cookie cutter, cut out shapes. Repeat, reusing scraps, to make a total of 22 biscuits.
2: Arrange biscuits 1 inch apart on prepared cookie sheets, brush tops with cream and bake until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes. Transfer biscuits on sheets to a rack and cool 5 minutes. Using a metal spatula, transfer biscuits to rack and cool to lukewarm. Serve warm or at room temperature.  Makes 22 biscuits.
recipe_description: Not only are herb and cheese biscuits fantastic with a ham dinner, they pair well with soups and salads too.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3 3/4- 4 1/4 cups  bread flour
1: 1  package active dry yeast
2: 1 1/4 cups  water
3: 1  teaspoon  salt
4: 1/2 cup  oil-packed dried tomatoes
5: 2  tablespoons  finely chopped onion
6: 1   clove garlic, minced
7: 1   slightly beaten egg white
recipe_instructions:
0: Drain tomatoes, reserving 1 tablespon oil. Coarsely chop tomatoes. Set tomatoes and oil aside. Grease a baking sheet. Set aside.
1: In large bowl, combine 1-1/3 cups of the flour and the yeast. In a saucepan, heat reserved oil, water and salt until warm (120 degree F to 130 degree F). Add to flour mixture. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping side of bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes. Using a spoon, stir in tomatoes, onion, garlic, and as much remaining flour as you can.
2: Turn out onto a floured surface. Knead in enough remaining flour to make a moderately stiff dough that's smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total). Shape into a ball. Place in a greased bowl; turn once to grease surface. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled (1-1/4 to 1-1/2 hours).
3: Punch dough down. Cover and let rise until doubled (30 to 40 minutes).
4: Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes. Shape each half into a round loaf.* Place on prepared baking sheet and flatten slightly to 5-1/2 inches in diameter. Cover and let rise in a warm place until nearly doubled (about 40 minutes). Brush tops with egg white.
5: Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until done. Cover loosely with foil during the last 10 to 20 minutes of baking to prevent overbrowning. Remove from pans; cool on wire racks. Makes 2 loaves.

recipe_name: Grilled Picante Beef and Vegetable Wraps
recipe_instructions:
0: Stir the mayonnaise and 1/2 cup picante sauce in a large bowl. Stir in the lime juice, red pepper, cumin and celery seed. Add the cabbage and pepper and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate until serving time.
1: Thoroughly mix the ground beef, onions, remaining picante sauce, cheese and corn chips in a large bowl. Shape the mixture firmly into 6 2-inch thick burgers.

Place the burgers onto the tortillas and top with the coleslaw. Wrap the tortillas around the burgers and cut into diagonal halves. Sprinkle with the cilantro.
recipe_description: Here's some deliciously different burgers, stylish enough to serve to guests. They're seasoned with picante sauce, shredded cheese and onion, topped with a sassy cole slaw and wrapped in warm tortillas.

recipe_name: All-American Burger with Red Pepper Relish
recipe_instructions:
0: For relish, combine red sweet pepper strips, ripe olives, olive oil, thyme, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a food processor bowl. Cover and process with several on-off turns until coarsely chopped. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
1: Combine onion, bread crumbs, catsup, horseradish, mustard, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a medium mixing bowl. Add ground beef; mix well. Shape the meat mixture into four 3/4-inch-thick patties.

recipe_instructions:
0: For onions, tear a 36x18-inch piece of heavy foil. Fold in half to make a double thickness of foil that measures 18x18 inches. Place onions in the center of the foil. Combine melted margarine, mustard, and honey. Drizzle over onions. Bring up two opposite edges of foil and seal with double fold. Then fold remaining ends to completely enclose onion mixture, leaving space for steam to build. Place packet on an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 15 minutes.

Turn patties. Grill for 8 to 10 minutes more or until an instant-read thermometer inserted in side of patty registers 160 degree F. and onions are tender. To serve, toast both sides of Texas toast on grill. Top each slice of Texas toast with a lettuce leaf, a burger, a tomato slice, and one-fourth of the onions. Sprinkle with fresh ground pepper, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Grill on the well-oiled rack of an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 10 minutes. Turn with a spatula and grill 10 to 12 minutes more, until meat is cooked and a meat thermometer registers 160 degree F internal temperature. Toast buns, cut side down on grill during last 1 to 2 minutes of grilling. To serve, top bottom half of bun with lettuce, burger, tomato, onions, pickles. Spread top half of bun with ketchup or mustard; top sandwich. Makes 4 burgers.

4: 3  teaspoons  grated orange zest

recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly butter and flour a 12-cup bundt pan, shaking out excess flour. Set aside.
1: Combine butter and sugar in the bowl of a standing mixer. Cream, using paddle attachment, until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well and scraping the bowl after each addition. Add vanilla and orange zest. Mix well.
2: Combine 2-1/2 cups of the flour, salt and baking powder on a large sheet of parchment or waxed paper. Add half to butter mixture in bowl, then the sour cream, then remaining flour mixture, beating until smooth. Toss cranberries with remaining 1 tablespoon flour, then fold into batter.
3: Pour into prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes. Reduce temperature to 325 degrees F and bake 20 minutes, or until a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove to a wire rack to cool.
4: Place beaten egg white in a small bowl. Dip cranberries and orange peel in egg white, then in granulated sugar. Let dry on a plate. In a medium-size bowl, blend confectioners' sugar and 2 tablespoons water until smooth (adding more water if too thick). Spoon over cake, allowing to drip down sides. Arrange sugared peel over cake (do not eat garnish, as consuming raw egg whites is not recommended).
recipe_description: Oranges and cranberries join forces in this delectable dessert recipe. Garnished with sugared cranberries and orange peel, this cake makes an impressive presentation for the holidays.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
1: 1 1/2 cups  sugar
2: 2   eggs
3: 1  cup  sour cream
4: 2  teaspoons  vanilla extract
5: 2  cups  flour
6: 1  teaspoon  baking powder
7: 1  teaspoon  baking soda
8: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
9: 1  teaspoon  cinnamon
10: 1/2 cup  chopped pecans (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 325 degrees F.
1: Coat a 9-inch square baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
2: Beat butter and 1 cup of the sugar until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in sour cream and vanilla.
3: Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.  Stir into batter until smooth.
4: Spoon half of the batter into pan.Combine remaining 1/2 cup sugar, the cinnamon and nuts (if using) in a small bowl. Sprinkle 2/3 of it over the batter. Top with remaining batter and sprinkle with remaining cinnamon-sugar mixture.
5: Bake at 325 degrees F for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm.
recipe_description: Sugar and cinnamon make a perfectly delectable topping for this any-occasion dessert recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
1: 1  teaspoon  baking powder
2: 3/4 teaspoon  salt
3: 6  tablespoons  yellow cornmeal
4: 2   large eggs
5: 1   large egg yolk
6: 2/3 cup  milk
7: 1/2 cup  olive oil
8: 2  teaspoons  grated lemon zest
9: 1 1/2 cups  sugar
10: 2  tablespoons  unsalted butter
11: 2  10  ounces  bags frozen pitted cherries
12: 1/4 cup  freshly squeezed lemon juice
recipe_name: Skillet Corn Cake with Stewed Cherries
recipe_instructions:
0: Place a 10-inch cast-iron skillet in the oven and preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
1: In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir in the cornmeal.
2: In a separate medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, egg yolk, milk, olive oil, and lemon zest until frothy. Add 3/4 cup of the sugar, and whisk to combine. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and mix just until the batter is smooth.
3: Swirl the butter in the hot cast-iron skillet until it has melted, and then pour the batter into the skillet. Return the skillet to the oven and cook until the center is set, about 25 minutes.
4: While the cake is baking, set a 10-inch skillet over high heat, and add the cherries, lemon juice, and remaining 3/4 cup sugar. Cook until the cherries have released most of their juice, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside until ready to use.
5: Allow the cake to cool in the skillet for 5 minutes. Then slice it into wedges and serve with the stewed cherries spooned over the top.
recipe_description: Prepare the deceptively delicious cherry sauce while the corn cake is baking. Since frozen cherries are available year-round, you'll never need to wait for cherry season to enjoy this dessert.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  sifted cake flour
1: 1 3/4 cups  sugar
2: 1  tablespoon  ground cinnamon
3: 1  teaspoon  baking powder
4: 1  teaspoon  baking soda
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1/2 teaspoon  ground allspice
7: 1 1/4 cups  finely shredded carrot
8: 1  8 1/4 ounce can crushed pineapple (syrup pack)
9: 3/4 cup  mayonnaise
10: 4   eggs
11: 1  cup  chopped walnuts, toasted
12: Cream Cheese Frosting (recipe follows)
13: 1  8  ounce package cream cheese, softened
14: 1/2 cup  unsalted butter, softened
15: 2  teaspoons  vanilla
16: 4  cups  sifted powdered sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: Grease and flour two 8x1-1/2-inch or 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans. Set the pans aside.
1: In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, salt and allspice. Add carrot, undrained pineapple, mayonnaise and eggs. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till moistened. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. By hand, stir in walnuts.
2: Pour the batter into the prepared pans. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean. Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Loosen sides. Remove cakes from pans. Cool thoroughly on wire racks.
3: To assemble, place 1 cake layer on a serving plate. Spread layer with about 1/2 cup of the Cream Cheese Frosting. Top with second layer. Spread top and sides with the remaining frosting. Store, covered, in refrigerator. Makes 14 servings.
4: In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, butter, and vanilla with an electric mixer on medium speed till light and fluffy. Gradually beat in enough powdered sugar (about 4 cups) to make a frosting of spreading consistency. Makes 3-1/2 cups.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  all-purpose flour
1: 2  cups  sugar
2: 2  teaspoons  baking powder
3: 1  teaspoon  ground cinnamon
4: 1/2 teaspoon  baking soda
5: 3  cups  finely shredded carrots
6: 1  cup  cooking oil
7: 4   eggs
8: 1  cup  chopped pecans
9: Cream Cheese Frosting (see recipe below)
10: 2  3  ounce packages cream cheese, softened
11: 2  teaspoons  vanilla
12: 4 - 4 1/2 cups  sifted powdered sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large mixing bowl, stir together the all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, ground cinnamon, and baking soda.
1: Add the finely shredded carrots, the cooking oil, and eggs. Beat the mixture with an electric mixer until it's just combined. Stir in the chopped pecans.
2: Transfer the carrot mixture to a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool the cake in the pan on a wire rack.
3: Prepare the Cream Cheese Frosting. Spread the frosting over the cooled cake. Cover and store in the refrigerator. Makes 16 bars.
4: In a medium mixing bowl, beat together cream cheese, softened, and vanilla with an electric mixer until the ingredients are light and fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of sifted powdered sugar, beating the mixture well. Gradually beat in 2 to 2-1/2 cups additional sifted powdered sugar until mixture is spreadable. Makes 1-1/2 cups frosting.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6 3/4 ounces  (1-1/2 cups) all-purpose flour
1: 2  tablespoons  granulated sugar
2: 1/2 teaspoon  baking powder
3: Pinch table salt
4: 2  ounces  (4 tablespoons) unsalted cold butter, cut into small pieces
5: 1   large egg, beaten slightly
6: 1  tablespoon  cold water; 1-1/2 teaspoons more if needed
7: 1/2 cup  cashews, well toasted
8: 1/2 cup  sliced almonds, well toasted
9: 1/2 cup  walnut pieces, well toasted
10: 1/3 cup  shredded coconut, well toasted
11: 1/2 cup  golden raisins
12: 1 1/4 cups  warm Butterscotch Sauce
13: 4  ounces  (8 tablespoons) unsalted butter
14: 2/3 cup  firmly packed dark brown sugar
15: 2/3 cup  sugar
16: 1 1/2 teaspoons  salt
17: 2  tablespoons  water
18: 3/4 cup  light corn syrup
19: 3/4 cup  heavy cream
20: 2  teaspoons  vanilla extract
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add the butter and cut it into the dough using two knives, a pastry blender, or your fingertips until the dough looks crumbly. Add the egg and 1 tablespoon water; mix with a fork until the dough just holds together. (If the dough won't come together, add up to another 1-1/2 teaspoons water, a tiny bit at a time.) Don't overmix; the dough should feel slightly sticky. Shape the dough into a 6-inch log. Wrap it in plastic and refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour.
1: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the chilled dough into six equal pieces. Roll each piece into a round about 1/8 inch thick. Prick the rounds all over with a fork and gently fit them into 4-inch tartlet pans, trimming any excess dough.
2: Line each tartlet with foil and fill with dried beans or pie weights. Bake the tartlet shells for about 15 minutes. Remove the pie weights and the foil and bake an additional 5 minutes until golden. Cool on a rack.
3: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the toasted nuts, coconut, and raisins with the warm butterscotch sauce. Divide the filling among the six tartlet shells. Bake until the filling just starts to bubble, 7 to 9 minutes. Using a wide spatula, carefully transfer the tartlets to a rack. Allow the tartlets to cool for 5 minutes. Carefully remove the tartlets from their pans and serve warm with a dollop of unsweetened whipped cream or creme fraiche, if you like.
4: In a medium, heavy-based saucepan, melt the butter. Stir in the two sugars, the salt, water, and corn syrup. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve the sugars. Let the mixture boil for 5 minutes, stirring often. You'll see big, slow bubbles as it boils. Remove the sauce from the heat. Carefully whisk in the cream and vanilla (the sauce may sputter). Allow the sauce to cool to warm before serving.
5: Make Ahead: Refrigerated, this sauce will keep for about two weeks. Reheat it gently, adding a little cream if it's too thick.
recipe_description: You'll need six 4-inch tartlet pans to make these small tarts. If you don't have all the nuts on hand, just use 1-1/2 cups total of what you do have; I've made this recipe with just cashews--it's delicious.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   box Betty Crocker® SuperMoist® carrot cake mix
1: 1/2 cup  vegetable oil
2: 1/4 cup  water
3: 2   eggs
4: 3/4 cup  raisins
5: 1/2 cup  chopped nuts
6: 1   container Betty Crocker® Rich & Creamy cream cheese frosting
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F (325 degrees F for dark or nonstick pan). Grease and flour, or spray with baking spray with flour, bottom and sides of 15x10x1-inch pan.
1: In large bowl, mix cake mix, oil, water and eggs with spoon. Stir in raisins and nuts. Spread evenly in pan.
2: Bake 18 to 24 minutes (25 to 29 minutes for dark or nonstick pan) or until bars spring back when touched lightly in center. Cool completely, about 1 hour. Spread with frosting. For bars, cut into 8 rows by 6 rows.  Store loosely covered at room temperature.
3: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Bake 22 to 27 minutes.
recipe_description: Love carrot cake? Try a sweet cousin in bar form made with the help of a cake mix.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 cups  sliced almonds
1: 1  box Betty Crocker® SuperMoist® white cake mix
2: 1 1/4 cups  water
3: 1/3 cup  vegetable oil
4: 3   eggs
5: 1  teaspoon  almond extract
6: 1/2 cup  butter or margarine
7: 1  cup  packed brown sugar
8: 1/4 cup  milk
9: 2  cups  powdered sugar
recipe_name: Toasted Almond Cupcakes with Caramel Frosting
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F (325 degrees F for dark or nonstick pans). Place paper baking cup in each of 24 regular-size muffin cups. In shallow pan, bake almonds 6 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden brown. Cool 15 minutes. Reserve 1 cup almonds for garnish. In food processor, grind remaining almonds until finely ground.
1: In large bowl, beat cake mix, water, oil, eggs and almond extract with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. (Batter will be lumpy.) Fold in ground almonds. Divide batter evenly among muffin cups.
2: Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan to cooling rack. Cool completely, about 30 minutes.
3: In 2-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low; boil and stir 2 minutes. Stir in milk. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Cool to lukewarm, about 30 minutes.
4: Gradually stir powdered sugar into brown sugar mixture. Place saucepan of frosting in bowl of cold water. Beat with spoon until smooth and spreadable. If frosting becomes too stiff, stir in additional milk, 1 teaspoon at a time. Frost a few cupcakes at a time with 1 tablespoon frosting each; press reserved almonds lightly into frosting. Store loosely covered at room temperature.
5: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Make 30 cupcakes.
recipe_description: In this recipe, nutty, easy-mix cupcakes are topped with a rich, cooked brown sugar frosting.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  sugar
1: 1  tablespoon  vegetable oil
2: Generous dash ground cinnamon
3: 8  slices Pepperidge Farm® Whole Grain Soft Honey Whole Wheat Bread, crusts removed and cut into cubes (about 3 cups)
4: 1  cup  coarsely chopped unblanched almond
5: 1  cup  dried apple, diced
6: 1  cup  dried cranberries
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F.
1: Stir the sugar, oil and cinnamon in a large bowl.  Add the bread cubes and almonds and toss to coat.  Spread the bread mixture on a rimmed baking sheet.
2: Bake for 15 minutes or until the bread cubes are lightly browned, stirring occasionally.  Let the mixture cool completely on the baking sheet on a wire rack.
3: Place the bread mixture into a large bowl or resealable container.  Stir in the apples and cranberries.
4: You can substitute Pepperidge Farm® Whole Grain Cinnamon Swirl Bread for the Soft Honey Whole Wheat Bread. Just omit the dash of ground cinnamon from the recipe.
recipe_description: Here's a crunchy, quick and tasty breakfast idea that also makes a great snack.  It features dried apples and cranberries tossed with almonds and toasted cinnamon sugar bread cubes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  cups  sliced fresh strawberries
1: 1/2 cup  granulated sugar
2: 2 1/4 cups  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
3: 3  tablespoons  granulated sugar
4: 2 1/2 teaspoons  baking powder
5: 1  teaspoon  salt
6: 3/4 cup  milk
7: 1/2 cup  butter or margarine, melted
8: 1  bag semisweet chocolate chips (1 cup, 6 ounces)
9: 1  tablespoon  shortening
10: 1 1/2 cups  whipping cream
11: 1/3 cup  powdered sugar
12: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
13: Additional strawberries, if desired
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Lightly grease cookie sheet with shortening. In medium bowl, mix strawberries and 1/2 cup granulated sugar; set aside.
1: To make shortcakes, in medium bowl, mix flour, 3 tablespoons granulated sugar, the baking powder and salt. Stir in milk and butter until soft dough forms. Onto cookie sheet, drop dough by 8 heaping tablespoonfuls. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet to cooling rack. Cool completely.
2: In small microwavable bowl, microwave chocolate chips and shortening uncovered on Medium 1 to 2 minutes, stirring after 1 minute, until melted.
3: In chilled medium bowl, beat whipping cream, powdered sugar and vanilla with electric mixer on high speed until soft peaks form.
4: Break shortcakes into bite-size pieces. In parfait glasses, alternate layers of shortcake, strawberries, chocolate mixture and whipped cream. Garnish with additional strawberries.
recipe_description: Try this shortcake parfait recipe made with Gold Medal® all-purpose flour from Betty Crocker.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2 1/4 cups  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
1: 1/2 teaspoon  baking powder
2: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
3: 1 1/2 cups  packed light brown sugar
4: 3/4 cup  granulated sugar
5: 1  cup  butter, softened
6: 4   eggs
7: 2  teaspoons  vanilla
8: 3/4 cup  milk
9: 1  cup  butter
10: 1/2 cup  packed light brown sugar
11: 2  tablespoons  milk
12: 1  tablespoon  light corn syrup
13: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
related_categories:
0: Birthday Cake
1: Bundt Cake
2: Cake
3: Desserts
recipe_name: Brown Sugar Cake with Buttery Brown Sugar Sauce
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease bottom and side of 12-cup fluted tube cake pan or 10-inch angel food (tube cake) pan with shortening; lightly flour. In medium bowl, mix flour, baking powder and salt; set aside.
1: In large bowl, beat 1-1/2 cups brown sugar, the granulated sugar and softened butter with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on medium speed about 5 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally, until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add 2 teaspoons vanilla. Beat in flour mixture alternately with 3/4 cup milk on low speed until smooth. Pour into pan.
2: Bake 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of cake comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan to cooling rack. Cool completely, about 2 hours.
3: Meanwhile, in 2-quart saucepan, heat sauce ingredients except vanilla to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly; boil and stir 2 minutes. Remove from heat; cool to room temperature. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla. Serve warm sauce with cake.
4: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Increase flour to 2-1/2 cups; increase milk to 1 cup. Bake 55 to 65 minutes.
recipe_description: The recipe title says it all--rich buttery brown sugar flavor, mmm.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3/4 cup  whole blanched almonds
1: 2/3 cup  plus 1/2 cup unsalted pistachios  (about 7 ounces)
2: 6  tablespoons  unsalted butter, softened
3: 1 1/4 cups  sugar
4: 4   large eggs
5: 1  tablespoon  finely grated  lemon zest
6: 1  tablespoon  fresh lemon juice
7: 1   vanilla bean, halved lengthwise and seeds scraped
8: 1/4 cup  plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
9: 2/3 cup  all-purpose flour
10: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
11: Finely grated zest of 1 lemon
12: Juice of 2 lemons
13: 1/4 cup  sugar
14: 2  tablespoons  water
15: Creme fraiche, for serving
recipe_instructions:
0: MAKE THE CAKE: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 10-inch round cake pan, line the bottom with parchment paper and butter the paper. In a food processor, pulse the almonds with 23 cup of the pistachios until finely ground.
1: In a large bowl, using a handheld electric mixer, beat the butter with the sugar at medium speed until it's the texture of moist sand. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well between additions. Add the lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla seeds and beat until smooth. Gradually beat in the olive oil in a thin stream. Using a rubber spatula, fold in the ground nuts, flour, and salt. Scrape the batter into the prepared pan.
2: Bake the cake for about 55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Transfer the pan to a rack and let the cake cool for 15 minutes. Invert the cake onto the rack and peel off the parchment paper. Invert the cake again onto a serving plate.
3: Meanwhile, toast the remaining 1/2 cup of pistachios in a pie plate for about 8 minutes, or until fragrant.
4: MAKE THE SYRUP: In a small saucepan, combine the lemon zest, lemon juice, sugar, and water and bring to a simmer over moderate heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Pour the syrup over the warm cake and scatter the toasted pistachios all over the top. Let stand for 1 hour, then cut into wedges and serve with creme fraiche.
5: The cake can be kept in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days.
recipe_description: The original recipe for Ryan Hardy's delicious citrusy, nutty, and dense cake comes from London's River Cafe restaurant. He substitutes olive oil for some of the butter and insists that it be served with tangy creme fraiche and an espresso.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  sugar
1: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
2: 3/4 cup  blackberries, halved
3: 3/4 cup  blueberries
4: 3/4 cup  raspberries
5: 1 1/2 cups  frozen whipped topping, thawed
6: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
7: 1  teaspoon  baking powder
8: Pinch salt
9: 4   large eggs
10: 3/4 cup  granulated sugar
11: 2  teaspoons  vanilla extract
12: 2  tablespoons  confectioners' sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
1: In a small saucepan, stir together the sugar and cornstarch. Stir in berries and 1 tablespoon water and heat over medium heat. Cook 9 to 10 minutes, until thickened, bubbly and most of the berries have popped. Break up remaining berries with a spoon. Remove from heat; cool.
2: Coat a 15 x 10 x 1-inch jelly roll pan with nonstick cooking spray. Line bottom of pan with parchment or waxed paper. Spray paper. In a medium-size bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, beat the eggs with an electric mixer for 5 minutes, until very light yellow. Add granulated sugar in batches, beating until smooth. Beat in vanilla extract.
3: Fold flour mixture into egg mixture until no lumps remain. Pour into prepared pan, spreading level. Bake at 350 degrees F for 12 to 14 minutes or until lightly browned.
4: Meanwhile, dust a clean kitchen towel with confectioners' sugar. When cake is done, turn out onto towel. Roll up towel and cake; cool completely.
5: Unroll cake; spread with filling. Roll up again, without the towel. Frosting: Transfer cake to a platter; spread with thawed whipped topping. Slice and serve.
recipe_description: Fresh blackberries, blueberries, and raspberries make the perfect filling for this white jelly roll cake. Serve with a few berries on the side to make this dessert extra special.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  milk chocolate pieces
1: 1/4 cup  whipping cream
2: 1/4 cup  plus 1 Tbsp. butter
3: 1   egg
4: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
5: 2  teaspoons  unsweetened cocoa powder
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 3/4 cup  sugar
8: 2  teaspoons  red food coloring
9: 1/2 teaspoon  vanilla
10: 1/2 cup  buttermilk
11: 1/2 teaspoon  baking soda
12: 1/2 teaspoon  vinegar
13: Raspberry preserves (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: For truffle filling, in a small saucepan combine chocolate pieces, cream, and 1 Tbsp. butter. Stir over low heat until chocolate is melted. Transfer to a small bowl; cool for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cover and freeze about 1 hour, until fudgelike consistency. Divide filling in 12 portions. Working quickly with hands, roll each portion in a ball. Place truffles in freezer.
1: Meanwhile, let 1/4 cup butter and egg stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 12 (2-1/2-inch) muffin cups with paper bake cups. Set aside.
2: For batter, in a small bowl stir together flour, cocoa powder, and salt; set aside. In a medium mixing bowl beat the 1/4 cup softened butter with mixer on medium to high for 30 seconds. Gradually add sugar; beat on medium until combined. Beat on medium 2 minutes more, scraping bowl occasionally. Beat in egg, food coloring, and vanilla. Alternately add flour mixture and buttermilk, beating on low after each addition just until combined. In a small bowl combine baking soda and vinegar; stir into batter.
3: Divide half the batter among the prepared cups, partially filling cups. Place a frozen truffle on batter in each cup, centering truffles away from sides of cups. Spoon remaining batter into cups, covering truffles.
4: Bake for 15 to 18 minutes, until tops spring back when lightly touched. Remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm, topped with raspberry preserves.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  poppy seeds (about 1-1/2 oz.)
1: 3/4 cup  milk
2: 1 1/2 teaspoons  vanilla
3: 5   eggs
4: 3/4 cup  butter
5: 1 3/4 cups  all-purpose flour
6: 1  teaspoon  baking powder
7: 1  teaspoon  salt
8: 1/2 cup  sugar
9: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
10: 1 1/2 cups  milk
11: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
12: 1 1/2 cups  sugar
13: 1 1/2 cups  whipping cream
14: 1/2 cup  sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small bowl, soak poppy seeds in 3/4 cup milk and 11/2 teaspoons vanilla for 1 hour. Meanwhile, separate eggs. Let egg whites, yolks and the butter stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Grease two 8- or 9-inch round cake pans. Line bottoms with parchment paper; grease again and lightly flour. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt; set aside.
1: For filling: In a heavy medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup sugar and the cornstarch. Gradually stir in  11/2 cups milk and the egg yolks. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla. Pour filling into a bowl. Cover the surface with plastic wrap and chill until completely cooled. Do not stir.
2: For cake: Preheat oven to 375 degrees . In a large bowl, beat butter with an electric mixer on medium speed for 30 seconds. Gradually add 11/2 cups sugar, about 2 tablespoons at a time, beating on medium to high speed until sugar is nearly dissolved. Alternately add flour mixture and poppy seed mixture, beating on low to medium speed after each addition just until combined. Thoroughly wash beaters.
3: In another large bowl, beat egg whites on medium to high speed until stiff peaks form (tips stand straight when beaters are lifted). Gently fold egg whites into cake batter. Divide batter between prepared pans.
4: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes for 8-inch pans or  25 to 30 minutes for 9-inch pans or until a wooden toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
recipe_description: The recipe for this four-layer cake--with a puddinglike filling, unmistakable poppy seed flavor and soft whipped cream frosting--comes from Wisconsins White Gull Inn.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  cranberry juice
1: 1 1/2 cups  dried cranberries
2: 2 2/3 cups  all-purpose flour
3: 2 1/4 teaspoons  baking powder
4: 1/4 teaspoon  baking soda
5: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
6: 3/4 cup  unsalted butter, softened
7: 1 1/3 cups  granulated sugar
8: 6   large egg whites
9: 1 1/2 teaspoons  vanilla
10: 1/2 teaspoon  coconut extract
11: 3/4 cup  buttermilk
12: 3/4 cup  unsalted butter, softened
13: 1/3 cup  unsweetened coconut milk (find with Asian foods)
14: 2  pounds  powdered sugar
15: 1  teaspoon  coconut extract
16: 1  cup  chopped walnuts, toasted
17: 1 1/2 cups  flaked coconut, toasted
recipe_name: Toasted Coconut Cake with Walnuts and Cranberries
recipe_instructions:
0: Grease and flour three 9-inch round cake pans; set aside.
1: In a medium saucepan bring cranberry juice to boiling; add dried cranberries then return to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat; cover and let stand at least 20 minutes. Drain.
2: Meanwhile, position two racks in center of oven. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a large mixing bowl, combine 3/4 cup butter and the granulated sugar; beat with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. With mixer on low speed, beat in the egg whites, vanilla, and 1/2 teaspoon coconut extract. On low speed and making three additions, beat the flour mixture into the sugar mixture, alternating with the buttermilk until combined. Evenly divide batter among the prepared pans*.
3: Bake cakes for 18 to 20 minutes, until a wooden pick inserted in center of each cake comes out clean. Cool in pans on wire racks 10 minutes. Remove from pans; cool cakes completely on wire racks.
4: For frosting, in a large mixing bowl beat 3/4 cup butter with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Gradually add 2 cups of the powdered sugar, beating well. Slowly beat in coconut milk and coconut extract. Gradually beat in remaining powdered sugar until fluffy (beat in milk, 1 teaspoon at a time, if frosting appears dry).
5: Place one cake layer on a cake plate. Spread with one-third of the frosting. Spread the cranberries on frosting. Place a second cake layer on cranberry filling. Spread with one-third of the frosting, then top with 2/3 cup of the walnuts and 1/2 cup of the coconut. Top with remaining layer. Spread with remaining frosting. Top with remaining coconut and walnuts.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3 1/2 cups  fresh or packaged whole-milk ricotta cheese
1: 1/2 cup  raisins
2: 3  tablespoons  dark rum
3: Butter, at room temperature for greasing pan
4: 1/4 cup  fine dry bread crumbs, or as needed
5: 5  large eggs, separated
6: 3/4 cup  sugar
7: Pinch salt
8: Grated zest of 1 large lemon
9: Grated zest of 1 large orange
10: 1/2 cup  heavy cream
11: 1/2 cup  pine nuts
recipe_instructions:
0: Spoon the ricotta into a large fine-mesh sieve or a colander lined with a double thickness of cheesecloth or basket-type coffee filter. Set the sieve over a bowl and cover the ricotta well with plastic wrap. Drain in the refrigerator at least overnight, or up to 24 hours. Discard the liquid in the bottom of the bowl.
1: In a small bowl, soak the raisins in rum, tossing occasionally, until the raisins are softened and have absorbed most of the rum, 1 to 2 hours.
2: Smear an 8-inch springform pan with enough softened butter to coat lightly. Sprinkle the bread crumbs over the butter to coat generously. Shake out the excess crumbs. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
3: In a large bowl, use a whisk to beat the egg yolks, sugar, and salt until pale yellow, Add the drained ricotta and lemon and orange zest, and beat until blended thoroughly. Beat in the heavy cream. Use a rubber spatula to fold in the pine nuts and the raisins and rum. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with a handheld electric mixer or wire whisk until they form stiff peaks. Fold about one-fourth of the egg white into the ricotta mixture to lighten ituse a large rubber spatula to scrape the batter from the bottom of the bowl up and over the whites. Fold in the remaining egg whites in the same way.
4: Pour the ricotta mixture into the prepared pan, and bake until the cake is golden brown on top and set in the center, about 1 hour and 10 minutes.
5: Cool the cake completely before removing the sides of the pan. Serve the cake at room temperature or chilled.
recipe_description: Cakes made with ricotta cheese, such as this one, are very typical of Italian desserts. Here, bread crumbs serve as the crust.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  canola oil
1: 2  cups  cut-up trimmed fresh asparagus or chopped trimmed broccoli
2: 1 1/2 cups  sliced fresh mushrooms
3: 1/2 cup  chopped red or yellow sweet pepper
4: Nonstick cooking spray
5: 3   whole grain English muffins, torn or cut into bite-size pieces (4 cups)
6: 2  cups  shredded smoked chicken or cooked chicken breast (10 ounces)
7: 3/4 cup  shredded Swiss cheese (3 ounces)
8: 1  cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed, or 4 eggs, lightly beaten
9: 1  cup  fat-free milk
10: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add asparagus, mushrooms, and sweet pepper; cook about 3 minutes or just until vegetables are crisp-tender.
1: Lightly coat six 12-ounce individual casserole dishes with cooking spray. Divide half of the English muffin pieces among the dishes. Top with the chicken, asparagus mixture, and 1/2 cup of the cheese. Top with the remaining English muffin pieces.
2: In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and black pepper. Pour egg mixture evenly over the layers in dishes. Using the back of a large spoon, press muffin pieces down. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Cover; chill for 2 to 24 hours.
3: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Bake, uncovered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in centers comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6 - 7   purchased croissants
1: 8  slices bacon
2: 1  cup  chopped onion
3: 1  cup  chopped red and/or green sweet peppers or sliced, halved zucchini
4: 1  cup  sliced fresh cremini mushrooms
5: 1 1/2 teaspoons  dried basil, oregano or thyme, crushed
6: 2  cups  lightly packed, coarsely chopped fresh spinach
7: 8  ounces  colby and Monterey Jack cheese or American cheese, shredded (2 cups)
8: 6   eggs
9: 2  cups  milk
10: 3  tablespoons  Dijon-style mustard
11: 1/2 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat the broiler. Slice the croissants in half horizontally. Arrange croissant halves, cut sides up, in a single layer on an extra--arge baking sheet. Broil 4 to 5 inches from the heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until light brown. Set aside.
1: In a very large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings in skillet. Crumble bacon; set aside.
2: Cook onion, sweet peppers, mushrooms, and basil in hot bacon drippings about 5 minutes or until vegetables are almost tender, stirring occasionally. Add spinach; stir until wilted and well coated. Transfer onion mixture to a colander set in sink; drain. Stir in bacon. Set aside.
3: In a greased 3-quart rectangular baking dish, arrange croissant bottoms, cut sides up, in a single layer, overlapping slightly. Sprinkle cheese over croissants. Spoon onion mixture over cheese; add croissant tops, cut sides down.
4: In a large bowl, beat eggs with a rotary beater; beat in milk, mustard and black pepper. Carefully pour egg mixture over strata; gently press down on croissants. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 8 to 24 hours.
5: Uncover strata. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Bake, uncovered, in a 325 degree F oven for 50 to 55 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean and strata puffs up, covering with foil the last 15 minutes of baking time to avoid overbrowning. Remove from oven. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve warm. Makes 10 to 12 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   egg yolks
1: 4   egg whites
2: 1/4 cup  butter or margarine
3: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
4: 1/4 teaspoon  dry mustard
5: dash ground red pepper
6: 1  cup  milk
7: 2  cups  shredded cheddar, colby, Havarti, and/or process Swiss cheese (8 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Allow the egg yolks and egg whites to stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
1: For cheese sauce, in a medium saucepan melt butter; stir in flour, dry mustard, and cayenne pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Add cheese, a little at a time, stirring until melted. In a medium bowl beat egg yolks with a fork until combined. Slowly add cheese sauce to egg yolks, stirring constantly. Cool slightly.
2: In a large mixing bowl beat egg whites with an electric mixer on medium to high speed until stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Gently fold about 1 cup of the stiffly beaten egg whites into cheese sauce.
3: Gradually pour cheese sauce over remaining stiffly beaten egg whites, folding to combine. Pour into an ungreased 2-quart souffle dish.
4: Bake in a 350 degree F oven for about 40 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Light, airy, and beautifully golden, this souffle main dish tastes even better when made with a combination of cheeses.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  ground beef
1: 1  15  ounce can tomato sauce
2: 1  cup  chopped onion
3: 1  cup  chopped green sweet pepper
4: 1/2 cup  water
5: 1  1 1/2 ounce package dry spaghetti sauce mix
6: 1  teaspoon  dried oregano, crushed
7: 1   clove garlic, minced
8: Several dashes bottled hot pepper sauce
9: 1  cup  milk
10: 1/4 cup  butter, melted
11: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
12: 2   eggs
13: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
14: 8  ounces  shredded mozzarella cheese (2 cups)
15: 1/2 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 12-inch skillet, cook ground beef until brown. Drain off the fat.
1: Stir in tomato sauce, onion, green pepper, water, spaghetti sauce mix, oregano, garlic, and hot pepper sauce. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
2: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, beat milk, eggs, butter, and cooking oil with an electric mixer on medium speed for 1 minute. Add the flour and beat for 2 minutes more.
3: Turn meat mixture into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan; sprinkle with the mozzarella. Top with the flour mixture. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. Bake in a 400 degree F oven about 30 minutes or until puffed and golden.
4: Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 10 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  tiny new potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1: 1/3 cup  thinly sliced leek
2: Nonstick cooking spray
3: 3/4 cup  chopped lower-fat and lower-sodium cooked ham
4: 3  ounces  reduced-fat Swiss cheese, cut into small pieces
5: 1 1/4 cups  fat-free milk
6: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
7: 3/4 cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed
8: 2  teaspoons  snipped fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, crushed
9: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a covered large saucepan cook sliced potatoes in a small amount of boiling, lightly salted water about 10 minutes or just until tender, adding the leek the last 5 minutes of cooking. Drain potato mixture.
1: Coat a 2-quart rectangular baking dish with cooking spray. Place potato mixture in bottom of the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with the ham and Swiss cheese.
2: In a medium bowl stir the milk into the flour until smooth. Stir in the egg product, thyme, and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over potato mixture.
3: Bake in a 350 degrees  oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve immediately.
recipe_description: Serve this thyme-flavored, ham, potato, and egg breakfast casserole for brunch or dinner with fresh fruit and juice.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine
2: 1 1/2 cups  sliced cremini mushrooms or sliced button mushrooms
3: 1  cup  chopped onion
4: 3  cups  chopped cooked chicken*
5: 1  15  ounce bottle mushroom alfredo pasta sauce
