7: 1  9 - 10  ounce package frozen cut asparagus or frozen peas, thawed
8: 1/2 cup  dairy sour cream
9: 1/2 cup  finely chopped bottled roasted red sweet peppers
10: 1  teaspoon  dried fines herbes or Italian seasoning, crushed
11: 1/2 cup  panko (Japanese bread crumbs) or fine dry bread crumbs
12: 1/4 cup  sliced almonds or chopped pecans, toasted
13: 2  tablespoons  grated Parmesan cheese
14: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine, melted
recipe_name: The Ultimate Chicken and Noodle Casserole
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain. Return to pan.
1: Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat until melted. Add mushrooms and onion; cook and stir until mushrooms are tender. Stir into pasta along with the chicken, pasta sauce, Italian-blend cheeses, asparagus, sour cream, sweet peppers and fines herbes. Transfer mixture to a 13x9x2-inch baking dish (3-quart rectangular).
2: In a small bowl, combine panko, nuts, Parmesan cheese and 2 tablespoons melted butter. Sprinkle over chicken mixture. Bake, uncovered, in a 350 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until heated through and topping is golden. Makes 6 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  10  ounce container refrigerated light Alfredo pasta sauce
1: 1/2 cup  milk
2: 2 1/2 cups  cooked white rice or wild rice
3: 2  cups  cubed cooked chicken
4: 1  cup  frozen peas
5: 1/3 cup  chopped bottled roasted red sweet peppers
6: 1/4 cup  slivered almonds, toasted (optional)
7: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil or 1/2 tsp. dried basil, crushed
8: 1  cup  soft bread crumbs
9: 1  tablespoon  butter, melted
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl combine pasta sauce and milk. Stir in rice, chicken, peas, sweet peppers, nuts, and basil. Transfer to 1-1/2-quart baking dish.
1: Bake, covered, 30 minutes. Uncover and stir. Combine bread crumbs and melted butter; sprinkle atop. Bake, uncovered, 20 to 25 minutes more or until heated through and crumbs are golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 4.
recipe_description: Looking for a yummy casserole recipe? This old-fashioned chicken and rice main dish is truly comfort food at its best.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 6  ounces  dried medium noodles
2: 3/4 pound  boneless chicken breast, cut into bite-size pieces
3: 1 1/2 cups  sliced fresh mushrooms
4: 4   green onions, sliced
5: 1/2 of a medium red sweet pepper, chopped
6: 1/4 cup  chicken broth
7: 2  cloves garlic, minced
8: 1  10 3/4 ounce can reduced-fat, reduced-sodium, condensed cream of broccoli or cream of chicken soup
9: 1  8  ounce container fat-free dairy sour cream
10: 1  teaspoon  dry mustard
11: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
12: 1  10  ounce package frozen chopped broccoli, thawed
13: 1/4 cup  fine dry bread crumbs
14: 1  tablespoon  butter or margarine, melted
recipe_instructions:
0: Coat a 13x9x2-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Set aside.
1: Cook noodles according to package directions, except omit salt or oil. Drain. Rinse with cold water and drain.
2: Coat a large skillet with more cooking spray. Add the chicken. Cook and stir over medium heat for 3 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Transfer the mixture from the skillet to a large mixing bowl.
3: Add mushrooms, green onions, red pepper, broth, and garlic to skillet. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
4: Transfer to large bowl with chicken. Add soup, sour cream, mustard, and pepper to chicken mixture. Gently stir in the noodles and broccoli.
5: Spoon into prepared baking dish. Mix bread crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over noodles. Cover with foil. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 10 to 15 minutes more or until heated through. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  lean ground beef
1: 1  15  ounce can Italian-style tomato sauce
2: 1  4  ounce can sliced mushrooms, drained
3: 1/4 cup  sliced pitted ripe olives (optional)
4: 1 - 1 1/2 cups  shredded mozzarella cheese (4 to 6 ounces)
5: 1  10  ounce package refrigerated biscuits (10 biscuits)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large skillet cook beef until brown. Drain off fat. Stir in tomato sauce, mushrooms, and olives (if using). Heat through. Transfer mixture to a 2-quart rectangular baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese.
1: Flatten each biscuit with your hands. Arrange the biscuits on top of cheese. Bake for 15 to 17 minutes or until biscuits are golden.
2: Makes 5 servings
recipe_description: A bubbly concoction of cheese, beef, and tomatoes is tucked beneath a golden brown biscuit topping for a family-friendly meal.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   medium eggplant (1 pound), peeled if desired
1: 2  tablespoons  margarine or vegetable oil spread
2: 1 1/2 cups  chopped onion
3: 2  cups  chopped green sweet pepper
4: 1  tablespoon  margarine or vegetable oil spread
5: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
8: 1/2 cup  sliced pitted ripe olives
9: 1/2 cup  shredded sharp American cheese or cheddar cheese (2 ounces)
10: 1  8  ounce can tomato sauce
11: 3/4 cup  soft bread crumbs (1 slice)
12: 1  tablespoon  margarine or vegetable oil spread, melted
recipe_instructions:
0: Cut eggplant into 1/2-inch cubes. Cook eggplant cubes in the 2 tablespoons margarine until tender. Remove from skillet.
1: In the same skillet cook onion and sweet pepper in the 1 tablespoon margarine until tender, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Stir in flour, salt, and black pepper. Add olives.
2: Layer half the eggplant in a 1-1/2-quart casserole. Add half the olive mixture and half the cheese. Repeat layers. Pour tomato sauce over all. Mix crumbs with melted margarine or vegetable oil spread; sprinkle over tomato sauce. Bake, uncovered, in a 375 degree F oven for about 30 minutes or until edges are bubbly. Makes 6 to 8 servings.
recipe_description: This vegetable side-dish casserole recipe goes well with chicken and fish. The original recipe, from the 1950s, called for eggplant when likely only one type was available. Today's cooks have more choices. Whichever variety is used, purchase slightly more than a pound to equal the 5 to 5-1/2 cups of cubes needed for this recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   medium white onion, sliced
1: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
2: 2   medium zucchini or other summer squash (10 ounces total), thinly sliced
3: 2  cups  salsa
4: 2  cups  chicken or vegetable broth
5: 4  cups  torn, stemmed spinach leaves (about 5 ounces)
6: 8  ounces  tortilla chips (about 8 cups, loosely packed)
7: 1/2 cup  finely grated Mexican queso anejo, Parmesan or Romano cheese (2 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, cook the onion in oil until tender, but not brown. Add zucchini. Cook and stir until the vegetables begin to brown.
1: Add salsa, broth and spinach. Bring to boiling. Add the tortilla chips and stir to coat. Remove from heat. Cover and let mixture stand for 5 minutes.
2: Very carefully stir the mixture to check that the chips have softened nicely. (Rick prefers them to have a few chewy edges. If there's still too much crunch remaining, the chef dribbles in a little extra broth and returns the mixture in saucepan to heat for a few minutes.)
3: Sprinkle with cheese. Serve from the pan. Or you can spoon mixture onto warm plates or into shallow bowls in the kitchen before sprinkling with cheese. Makes 4 to 6 main-dish servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  10 3/4 ounce can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Chicken Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
1: 1/2 cup  milk
2: 2   eggs
3: 1  16  ounce can whole kernel corn, drained
4: 1  8  ounce package corn muffin mix
5: 1/4 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
6: 1  2.8 ounce can French fried onions (about 1 1/3 cups)
recipe_instructions:
0: Beat the soup, milk and eggs in a medium bowl with a fork or whisk.  Stir in the corn, corn muffin mix, cheese, and 23 cup onions.  Pour the soup mixture into a 1 1/2-quart casserole.
1: Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes or until the mixture is hot.
2: Top with the remaining onions.  Bake for 5 minutes or until the onions are golden brown.
recipe_description: Reminiscent of cornbread, this enticing casserole adds the favorite flavor upgrade of corn in another form to any daily dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  bulk pork sausage
1: 1  8  ounce package sliced mushrooms
2: 2   stalks celery, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
3: 1   large red pepper, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
4: 1   large onion, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
5: 1  teaspoon  dried thyme leaves, crushed
6: 1/2 teaspoon  dried marjoram leaves, crushed
7: 1  6  ounce box seasoned long-grain and wild rice mix
8: 1 3/4 cups  Swanson® Chicken Stock
9: 1  10 3/4 ounce can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
10: 1  cup  shredded Cheddar cheese (about 4 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook the sausage in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it's well browned, stirring often to separate meat. Pour off any fat.
1: Add the mushrooms, celery, pepper, onion, thyme, marjoram and seasoning packet from the rice blend to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
2: Stir the sausage mixture, stock, soup, rice blend and 1/2 cup cheese in a 3-quart shallow baking dish. Cover the baking dish.
3: Bake at 375 degrees F. for 1 hour or until the sausage is cooked through and the rice is tender. Stir the sausage mixture before serving. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
4: For an extra-special touch, substitute 1 package (8 ounces) baby portobello mushrooms, sliced, for the sliced mushrooms.
recipe_description: Come in from the cold and enjoy this flavorful sausage, vegetable and rice casserole that's easy to put together and even better to eat!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8   meaty veal shanks, cut 1-1/2 inches thick  (7 pounds)
1: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
2: 6  tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil
3: 6   carrots, cut into 1/4-inch dice
4: 6   celery ribs, cut into 1/4-inch dice
5: 2   onions, cut into 1/4-inch dice
6: 6   garlic cloves, 4 whole, 2 minced
7: 3   bay leaves
8: 4  cups  chicken stock or low-sodium broth
9: 2  cups  dry white wine
10: 1  15  ounce can diced Italian tomatoes
11: 6   thyme sprigs
12: 2  2 1/2 inch strips orange zest, minced
13: 2  2 1/2 inch strips lemon zest, minced
14: 2  tablespoons  minced flat-leaf parsley
related_categories:
0: Casseroles
1: Italian Veal Dishes
2: More Veal Favorites
3: Veal
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Season the veal shanks with salt and pepper. In a very large, deep skillet, heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil until shimmering. Working in batches, cook the veal over moderately high heat until browned on both sides, about 8 minutes total per batch. Transfer the osso buco to a large roasting pan.
1: Add the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil to the skillet. Add the diced carrots, celery, onions, 4 whole garlic cloves, and the bay leaves and cook over moderate heat until they are softened, about 12 minutes. Add the chicken stock, white wine, diced tomatoes, and thyme sprigs and bring to a boil. Pour the vegetables and liquid over the veal, cover the roasting pan with foil and transfer to the oven. Braise the shanks for about 2-1/2 hours, until very tender.
2: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the orange zest, lemon zest, parsley, and the 2 minced garlic cloves. Lightly season the gremolata with salt and pepper.
3: Transfer the veal shanks to a baking sheet and cover with foil. Carefully strain the cooking liquid into a large bowl. Reserve the vegetables; discard the bay leaves and thyme sprigs. Pour the cooking liquid back into the roasting pan and boil over high heat until it is reduced by half, about 25 minutes. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Stir in the reserved vegetables and simmer over moderately low heat for 2 minutes. Transfer the osso buco to shallow bowls. Spoon the sauce and vegetables on top and sprinkle lightly with the gremolata. Serve with the remaining gremolata at the table.
4: The osso buco can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
recipe_description: Ethan Stowell sticks to Italian tradition when making osso buco, topping braised veal shanks with a citrusy gremolata (orange and lemon zest mixed with garlic and parsley). He advises spooning out and eating all of the marrow from the bones for what he calls "a mouthful of fatty goodness."

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
2: 1/2 cup  chopped green bell pepper
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
5: 1/4 teaspoon  seasoned salt
6: 3 1/2 cups  hot water
7: 1/2 cup  milk
8: 1  package Betty Crocker® Hamburger Helper® beef pasta
9: 1/4 cup  packed brown sugar
10: 1/4 cup  barbecue sauce
11: 2  tablespoons  ketchup
12: 1 1/2 cups  Original Bisquick® mix
13: 1  cup  milk
14: 2   eggs
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Casseroles
2: Ground Beef
3: Ground Beef Casserole
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In 10-inch skillet, cook beef, onion, bell pepper, salt, pepper and seasoned salt over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until beef is brown; drain.
1: Stir hot water, 1/2 cup milk and the Sauce Mix into beef mixture. Stir in brown sugar, barbecue sauce and ketchup. Heat to boiling, stirring occasionally.  Spoon beef mixture into ungreased rectangular baking dish, 13x9x2 inches; stir in uncooked pasta. Set aside.
2: In medium bowl, stir Bisquick mix, 1 cup milk and the eggs until blended. Pour evenly over beef mixture.
3: Bake cobbler 30 to 35 minutes or until light golden.

recipe_description: From Betty's Soul Food Collection...    Hamburger Helper jumpstarts casserole-making.  A touch of this and that make this one a winner.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1  6  ounce can French's® French Fried Onions (2 2/3 cups)
2: 1  cup  frozen peas, thawed
3: 1  cup  shredded Cheddar cheese (4 ounces)
4: 4  slices bacon, cooked and crumbled
5: 2  10 3/4 cans Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Celery Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
6: 1  cup  milk
recipe_instructions:
0: Stir the potatoes, 1 1/3 cups of the onions, peas, cheese and bacon in a 13 x 9-inch (3-quart) shallow baking dish. Stir the soup and milk in a medium bowl. Pour the soup mixture over the potato mixture. Cover.
1: Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes or until hot. Stir.
2: Sprinkle with the remaining onions. Bake for 5 minutes more or until the onions are golden brown.
3: Time-Saving Tip: To thaw the hash browns, cut off 1 corner on bag and microwave on HIGH for 5 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 15  ounce package (1 crust) rolled refrigerated unbaked piecrust
1: 1   medium fennel bulb
2: 1  pound  fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
3: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
4: 3/4 cup  fat-free milk
5: 2  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
6: 3   eggs
7: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil, crushed
8: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
9: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
10: 1  cup  shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese (4 ounces)
11: Fresh basil leaves (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Let piecrust stand at room temperature according to package directions. Line a 9-inch pie plate with piecrust. Crimp edge as desired. Line unpricked pastry with a double thickness of foil. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove foil. Bake for 4 to 5 minutes more or until pastry is set and dry. Remove from oven. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F.
1: Meanwhile, trim top off fennel bulb, reserving some of the feathery leaves for garnish. Trim fennel bulb and thinly slice. In a covered medium saucepan, cook fennel, asparagus, and onion in a small amount of boiling water for 4 to 6 minutes or just until vegetables are tender. Drain vegetables; set aside.
2: In a medium bowl, whisk together milk and flour until smooth. Add eggs, snipped or dried basil, salt, and pepper, whisking until combined.
3: Spoon fennel mixture into baked piecrust. Sprinkle with cheese. Slowly pour egg mixture over all.
4: Bake, uncovered, for 30 to 35 minutes or until egg mixture is set in center. If necessary to prevent overbrowning, cover edge of pie with foil for the last 5 to 10 minutes of baking. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Top with reserved fennel leaves and, if desired, fresh basil leaves.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  8  ounce package Mexican-blend shredded cheese
1: 1  15  ounce can black beans, rinsed and drained
2: 1  7  ounce can corn, drained
3: 2/3 cup  salsa
4: 2  tablespoons  chopped cilantro
5: 2  4 1/2- 4 3/4 ounce packages skinless, boneless roasted chicken breast
6: 2  10 - 12  inches  flour tortillas
recipe_instructions:
0: Place a burrito-size flour tortilla on a serving plate. Sprinkle with 1/4 of shredded cheese. In a bowl, combine black beans, corn, 1/3 cup salsa and 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro.
1: Spread bean mixture onto the tortilla. Sprinkle with another 1/4 of cheese. Top with a flour tortilla, and sprinkle with 1/4 of cheese. Slice chicken breast, and combine in bowl with 1/3 cup salsa and 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro. Place chicken mixture on top of cheese, sprinkle with remaining 1/4 of cheese, and top with a flour tortilla. Cover with a piece of parchment or wax paper, and microwave for 10 minutes at 50 percent power. Cut into slices.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1 1/2 cups  onion cut into small wedges
2: 4   cloves garlic, minced
3: 1  14 1/2 ounce can tomatoes, cut up
4: 1  10  ounce package frozen sliced okra
5: 1/2 cup  chicken broth
6: 1  teaspoon  yellow mustard
7: 1  teaspoon  Worcestershire sauce
8: 1/2 teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
9: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
10: 1/4 teaspoon  bottled hot pepper sauce
11: 1  8  ounce can whole kernel corn, drained
12: 1  8  ounce can baby lima beans, drained
13: 1/2 cup  cubed ham
14: 1  12  ounce jar brown gravy
recipe_instructions:

1: Add corn, lima beans, and ham. Stir in gravy. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: From Brunswick County, Virginia or North Carolina? The debate still rages over where this country hearty chicken stew gets its name.

recipe_instructions:

Remove chicken from skillet. Cool slightly; place in an airtight container. Chill at least 1 hour or up to 2 days until ready to serve.
1: In a large saucepan cook asparagus and pea pods, covered, in a small amount of boiling salted water for 2 to 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain; rinse with cold water. Drain well. Use immediately or place in an airtight container and chill up to 2 days.
2: To serve, in a very large bowl toss together chilled chicken, asparagus  spears,  pea pods, watercress, sweet peppers, and tomatoes. Add Garlic Ginger Soy Dressing; toss well. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Makes 12 servings.
3: In a screw-top jar combine rice vinegar, olive oil, minced garlic, honey, soy sauce, sesame seeds, ground ginger, salt, and black pepper. Cover and shake well. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator up to 1 week; shake before serving.
recipe_description: Eliminate the chicken for a vegetarian version of this main dish salad.

recipe_ingredients:

1: Salt (divided) and pepper
2: 2  teaspoons  canola oil
3: 2  cups  diced onion
4: 1 1/2 cups  diced celery
5: 1  cup  frozen diced carrots
6: 2  teaspoons  sage

11: 1  cup  water
12: 2  cups  cooked brown rice
recipe_instructions:

1: Add vegetable-and-spice mixture to chicken. Saute until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Add broth and the water. Cover pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes, until chicken pulls away from the bone. Remove chicken; discard bones and add meat back to the pot. Mix in rice; heat 2 to 3 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  mayonnaise
1: 3  tablespoons  finely chopped red onion
2: 3  tablespoons  finely chopped celery
3: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded lemon peel
4: 2  teaspoons  fresh lemon juice
5: 2  cups  chopped, cooked chicken (reserved from No-Fuss Snack Mix Chicken, bones removed if present)
6: 8  slices wheat bread, toasted if desired
7: Romaine lettuce leaves, arugula or lettuce
8: 8   thin tomato slices, about 1 medium tomato
recipe_instructions:
0: In medium bowl stir together mayonnaise, onion, celery, lemon peel, and lemon juice. Add chopped chicken, stir to coat; set aside.
1: Arrange lettuce leaves on 4 bread slices; top with tomato slices. Spoon chicken mixture on tomatoes; top with remaining bread slices. Serve immediately or wrap with plastic wrap and refrigerate up to 6 hours. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Chicken is added to a simple mayonnaise and lemon mixture for these quick-and-easy lunch sandwiches. Try multi-grain bread to add a healthy touch to this recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
1: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
2: 1  teaspoon  ground coriander
3: 1  teaspoon  ground cumin
4: 1  teaspoon  ground paprika
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1/2 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
7: 2   medium onions, cut into wedges
8: 3   cloves garlic, minced
9: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
10: 1  28  ounce can crushed tomatoes
11: 1  15  ounce can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained
12: 1 1/2 cups  water
13: 1/2 cup  raisins
14: 1/3 cup  small pitted ripe olives
15: 3  cups  hot cooked couscous
16: 1/4 cup  snipped fresh cilantro
recipe_instructions:
0: In a bowl coat chicken pieces with a mixture of flour, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, and cinnamon. Set aside.
1: In a 4-quart Dutch oven cook onion and garlic in hot oil about 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from Dutch oven, reserving oil in pan. Add chicken pieces, about half at a time, to pan. Cook quickly until lightly browned, stirring frequently. Return all chicken and the onion mixture to pan. Add crushed tomatoes, beans, water, raisins, and olives. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 10 minutes or until chicken is tender, stirring occasionally. Spoon couscous into soup bowls. Ladle stew over the couscous and sprinkle with snipped cilantro. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: This low fat chicken dish gives you a complete meal in just 35 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  cups  finely chopped fresh mushrooms
1: 1  14  ounce can reduced-sodium chicken broth
2: 1  cup  finely chopped onion
3: 1  teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
4: 1  teaspoon  dried basil, crushed
5: 1  cup  soft bread crumbs (1 1/3 slices bread)
6: 6   skinless, boneless chicken breast halves (about 2 pounds)
7: Salt and ground black pepper
8: 2  tablespoons  butter
9: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
10: 1  cup  purchased marinara sauce
11: 1/2 cup  whipping cream
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet, combine mushrooms, broth, onion, thyme and basil. Bring to boiling; reduce heat and boil gently, uncovered, about 20 minutes or till chicken broth has almost evaporated, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat; cool for 10 minutes. Stir in bread crumbs.
1: Meanwhile, place a chicken breast half between 2 pieces of plastic wrap. Using the flat side of a meat mallet, pound chicken lightly to about 1/4 inch thick. Remove plastic wrap. Repeat with remaining chicken breast halves. Sprinkle chicken breasts lightly with salt and pepper. Evenly spread about 1/4 cup of the filling on each chicken piece. Fold in the bottom and sides; roll up. Press all edges firmly to seal in the filling. Secure with wooden toothpicks.
2: In a 12-inch oven-going skillet, heat the butter and oil. Add chicken rolls. Cook over medium-high heat about 5 minutes or till golden brown, turning to brown all sides. Bake, uncovered, in a 375 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till chicken is no longer pink (170 degree F). Remove toothpicks.
3: Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, stir together marinara sauce and cream; heat through (do not boil). To serve, slice stuffed breasts. Serve with sauce. Makes 6 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/4 pounds  ground raw chicken
1: 2  cups  chopped onion
2: 1  teaspoon  salt
3: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
4: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
5: 3  tablespoons  packed brown sugar
6: 3  tablespoons  balsamic vinegar
7: 2  tablespoons  water
8: 1  tablespoon  unsalted butter
9: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
10: 2  large red tomatoes, thinly sliced
11: 1  large yellow tomato, thinly sliced

13: 1/2 cup  fresh basil leaves
14: 1/4 cup  oil-packed dried tomatoes
15: 1  clove garlic, sliced

18: 2 - 3  tablespoons  snipped fresh parsley
19: 1 - 2  tablespoons  crumbled farmers or goat cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 12-inch oven-going skillet, cook chicken, onion, salt and pepper in 2 tablespoon hot olive oil over medium heat for 10 minutes or until onion is tender and chicken is no longer pink, stirring frequently; drain and return to skillet. Stir in the brown sugar, vinegar and water. Cook and stir over medium heat for 5 minutes more. Remove meat mixture from skillet; set aside.
1: In the same skillet, heat the unsalted butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat until butter is melted, tilting skillet to coat bottom with melted butter mixture. Remove from heat. Arrange red and yellow tomato slices in the bottom of the skillet, overlapping slices as needed.
2: In a food processor, combine bread crumbs, basil leaves, dried tomatoes and garlic. Cover and process until basil is chopped and mixture is combined. Layer bread crumb mixture over tomatoes in skillet, pressing down lightly. Spoon cooked chicken mixture over bread crumb mixture. Sprinkle with shredded cheese.
3: Unroll pie crust and, if necessary, roll to diameter large enough to cover mixture in skillet. Lay pie crust on top of layers in skillet.
4: Bake in a 425 degrees  oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove skillet from oven. Let stand 5 minutes on a wire rack. Loosen edges; invert skillet over a large serving plate. Garnish with parsley and crumbled cheese. Serve warm.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  buttermilk
1: 2  tablespoons  chopped fresh dill
2: 2  tablespoons  chopped fresh chives
3: 2  cloves garlic, minced
4: 1  tablespoon  lemon juice
5: 1  teaspoon  Dijon-style mustard
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
8: 2  pounds  chicken breast tenders
9: Nonstick cooking spray
10: 4  cups  corn flakes, crushed
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl combine the buttermilk, herbs, garlic, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken to the bowl and turn to coat in the marinade. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes or overnight, stirring the mixture occasionally.
1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place a wire cooling rack in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan or over a baking sheet. Coat the rack with nonstick cooking spray; set aside. Place corn flakes in a shallow dish. Remove the chicken tenders from the marinade a few at a time and dip in crumbs to coat. Arrange chicken on prepared rack. Sprinkle with any remaining crumbs and pat lightly.
2: Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside and crumbs start to brown.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6   ears fresh corn
1: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2: 4  slices bacon (preferably thick-cut), chopped into 1/4-inch pieces
3: 1   onion, chopped
4: 4  cups  low-fat milk
5: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
6: 1/4 cup  chopped fresh parsely
7: 1  cup  shredded leftover chicken
recipe_instructions:
0: Shuck the corn, then stand each ear up in a bowl and use a knife to scrape off the kernels; set aside. Put the cobs, 1 cup water, and a sprinkle of salt and pepper in a 4-quart pot with a tight-fitting lid over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat so the water bubbles gently, cover, and cook for 20 to 30 minutes. Leave the cobs in the pot until you are ready to make the soup, then discard them, reserving the corncob stock.
1: In the last few minutes of cooking the corn, add 1 cup shredded leftover cooked chicken.
2: Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until it begins to render its fat and turns golden-brown, about 4 to 6 minutes. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, another 5 minutes or so.
3: Add the milk, reserved corn kernels, and bacon and onion to the stock, and bring to a boil; lower the heat so that the soup bubbles gently. Cook, uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until the corn is tender, about 10 minutes.
4: Whisk the cornstarch in a small bowl with 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Add to the soup, stirring until the soup thickens, about a minute. Taste, adjust the seasoning, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1/3 cup  vegetable oil
2: 1  teaspoon  salt
3: 1  cup  matzoh meal
4: 1 1/2 tablespoons  kosher salt, more to taste

recipe_instructions:
0: Whisk together the eggs, 1/2 cup cold water, the oil, and the salt. Stir in the matzoh meal slowly to avoid creating lumps. Stir until smooth and thick. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate until coldat least 2 hours. Makes 6 dozen.
1: In a large pot bring 4 quarts water and the salt to a boil. Place the celery, parsnip, onion, dill, and parsley sprigs in a large square of cheesecloth and tie with kitchen string. When the water comes to a boil, add the chicken, carrots, and vegetable bundle. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the carrots are soft, about 1 1/2 hours. Remove the chicken to a bowl and reserve for another use; remove and discard the vegetable bundle.
2: Form the matzoh mixture into 3/4-inch balls (keep a small bowl of water nearby to prevent hands from getting sticky).
3: Bring broth and carrots to a simmer. Drop in the matzoh balls and simmer until they are cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:

1: Add the beans and broth. Bring to boiling; reduce heat and cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until the flavors have melded, about 15 minutes. Serve over chips or rice, if desired, and garnish with cilantro and cheese.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 4  stalks celery, chopped (2 cups)
2: 2  medium carrots, shredded (1 cup)
3: 1  cup  chopped red sweet pepper
4: 2  4  ounce can (drained weight) sliced mushrooms, drained

6: 2  tablespoons  diced pimiento, drained

0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In an extra-large bowl, stir together chicken, celery, carrots, sweet pepper, mushrooms, almonds, and pimiento. Add soup to chicken mixture; mix well.
1: Transfer chicken mixture to an ungreased 3-quart rectangular baking dish. Bake, covered, for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with chow mein noodles. Bake, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes more or until heated through. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:

8: 2   medium carrots, cut into thin strips (about 2/3 cup)
9: Hot cooked rice or orzo (optional)
10: Fresh basil sprigs (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Fold four 28x12-inch pieces of foil in half to make four 14x12-inch rectangles. To assemble chicken bundles, place 1 chicken breast on each piece of foil, tucking under thin tip of the chicken breast. Fold up edges of foil slightly.
1: In a small bowl, stir together the oil, lemon juice, basil, salt and pepper. Drizzle oil mixture over the chicken breasts. Top with mushrooms, zucchini and carrots, dividing equally among chicken bundles.
2: Bring up 2 opposite edges of foil; seal with a double fold. Fold remaining ends to enclose the chicken and vegetables, leaving space for steam to build. Place foil bundles on a shallow baking pan.
3: Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till an instant-read thermometer inserted into chicken registers 170 degree F (carefully open foil when you check doneness).
4: Serve in foil packets or transfer chicken and vegetables to serving plates and drizzle with cooking juices. If you like, serve with rice or orzo and garnish with basil. Makes 4 servings.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1/3 cup  dried cranberries

3: 1/3 cup  fine dry bread crumbs
4: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh marjoram or 1 teaspoon dried marjoram, crushed

7: 4  thin slices fresh mozzarella cheese or 4 slices regular mozzarella cheese
8: 4   Kaiser rolls or sesame hamburger buns, split and toasted
9: Lettuce leaves
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small saucepan, bring orange juice to boiling. Remove from heat; stir in cranberries. Let stand for 5 minutes. Drain cranberries, discarding orange juice.
1: Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine ground chicken, bread crumbs, marjoram and salt. Shape chicken mixture into 8 1/2-inch-thick patties. (The mixture may be sticky. If necessary, wet hands to shape patties.)
2: Place one-fourth of the cranberries and one-fourth of the Parmesan cheese on the center of each of 4 patties. Top with the remaining patties; press edges to seal.
3: For a charcoal grill: Grill patties on the greased rack of an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 14 to 18 minutes or until no longer pink (165 degrees F)*, turning once halfway through grilling. (For a gas grill: Preheat grill. Reduce heat to medium. Place patties on greased grill rack over heat. Cover; grill as above.) Top each burger with a slice of mozzarella cheese. Grill, uncovered, about 3 minutes more or until cheese begins to melt. Serve burgers on toasted rolls with lettuce leaves. Makes 4 burgers.

recipe_ingredients:

recipe_description: Chicken drumsticks are served with a simple vegetable and rice mixture in this quick-fix dinner.

recipe_ingredients:

2: 1/2 cup  olive oil
3: 1  tablespoon  dried Italian seasoning, crushed
4: 2  teaspoons  minced fresh garlic
recipe_instructions:
0: Remove skin from the chicken, if you like. Put the chicken in a plastic bag set in a shallow baking dish.

2: Drain chicken, reserving the marinade. In a covered grill, arrange the preheated coals around a drip pan for indirect grilling. Test for medium heat above the pan.
3: Place the chicken on a grill rack, with the bone side up, over a drip pan. Cover the chicken and grill for 50 to 60 minutes or until the meat is tender and no longer pink, turning once. Brush the chicken once with the reserved marinade halfway through the grilling time.
4: Discard the remaining marinade. Garnish with sprigs of fresh herbs, if you like.

2: Reduce heat; cover and simmer about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pasta is tender.
3: Remove from heat; stir. Sprinkle each serving with 2 tablespoons cheese and tomato.
recipe_description: This ground beef dish gets its heat from three different sources--salsa, beans and chili powder.  Hamburger Helper® dinner mix makes it easy.

recipe_ingredients:

Simmer, uncovered, about 30 minutes or until slightly thickened. Serve topped with sour cream and bacon.

10: 2 1/2 cups  fat-free milk
11: 1/2 cup  fat-free half-and-half
12: 2  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
13: 3/4 cup  coarsely shredded carrots
recipe_instructions:
0: Drain clams, reserving liquid. Chop half of the clams; set chopped and whole clams aside. Add enough water to the reserved clam liquid to measure 1 1/2 cups; set clam liquid aside.
1: Coat a large saucepan with cooking spray; heat saucepan over medium heat. Add bacon, onion, and celery to saucepan. Cook for 5 to 8 minutes or until onion is tender and bacon is cooked through, stirring occasionally. Remove bacon from pan; drain on paper towels. Chop bacon and set aside.
2: Stir potatoes, cauliflower, thyme, pepper, and reserved clam liquid into onion mixture. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 10 to 12 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat; cool slightly. Transfer half of the potato mixture (about 2 cups) to a blender or food processor. Cover and blend or process until smooth. Return to the remaining potato mixture in saucepan.
3: In a medium bowl, whisk together milk, half-and-half, and flour until smooth. Add all at once to potato mixture. Cook and stir just until boiling. Stir in chopped and whole clams and carrots. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cook for 1 minute more. Sprinkle each serving with chopped bacon.
recipe_description: Using a combo of cauliflower and potatoes, rather than all potatoes, lowers the carbs in this creamy meal-in-a-bowl.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  large onion, chopped
1: 1  clove garlic, finely chopped
2: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
3: 1/4 teaspoon  red pepper flakes
4: 1  14 1/2 ounce can Italian-style stewed tomatoes
5: 1  8  ounce can no-salt-added tomato sauce
6: 1/2 pound  shrimp, peeled, deveined, halved lengthwise
7: 12  ounces  angel hair pasta
recipe_instructions:
0: Saute onion and garlic in oil in saucepan 3 minutes. Add pepper flakes; saute 1 minute.
1: Add tomatoes and sauce; simmer 5 minutes. Add shrimp; simmer until shrimp are translucent, 5 minutes.
2: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Top with sauce. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Diavolo is the Italian word for devil and refers to sauces seasoned with hot chiles. In this quick and easy recipe, the sauce is made with stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, and red pepper flakes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  fresh tuna steak, cut into 20 pieces (about 1-inch cubes, 1/2-inch thick)
1: 2  tablespoons  hoisin sauce
2: 2  tablespoons  reduced-sodium teriyaki sauce
3: 1  tablespoon  lime juice
4: 2  tablespoons  sesame seeds
5: 1  tablespoon  hoisin sauce
6: 1  tablespoon  reduced-sodium teriyaki sauce
7: 1  tablespoon  lime juice
8: 1  teaspoon  minced fresh ginger
9: 2  teaspoons  sugar
10: 1/4 teaspoon  hot pepper flakes
recipe_name: Sesame Tuna with Ginger Dipping Sauce
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
1: Combine hoisin, teriyaki and lime juice. Arrange tuna pieces in a glass baking dish just large enough to hold them in a single layer. Brush with hoisin mixture; let stand 15 minutes at room temperature or refrigerate for 2 hours.
2: Combine hoisin, teriyaki sauce, line juice, ginger, sugar and hot pepper. Microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds to dissolve sugar.
3: To serve, sprinkle tuna with sesame seeds. Bake at 350 degrees F for 8 to 10 minutes or until firm. Serve with dipping sauce.
recipe_description: For an appetizer with Asian flair, try these cubes of fresh tuna coated with sesame seeds. Serve with toothpicks so guests can dip the flavorful morsels in the spicy dipping sauce.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  pounds  carrots, peeled and cut into 3/4-inch pieces
1: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
2: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
3: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
4: 6  cups  vegetable broth
5: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
6: 1   large onion, peeled and chopped
7: 3   cloves garlic, peeled and chopped
8: 3  cups  arborio rice
9: 1  cup  dry white wine
10: 3/4 teaspoon  salt
11: 1  10  ounce box frozen corn, thawed
12: 1/4 cup  shredded Parmesan cheese
13: 1/4 cup  parsley, chopped
14: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
15: 2   cloves garlic, peeled and chopped
16: 1  pound  large shrimp, shells removed and deveined
17: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
18: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 450 degree F. Place carrots on large rimmed baking sheet and toss with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 450 degree F for 45 minutes or until fork tender. Serve half with the Corn and Shrimp Risotto and reserve half for Stuffed Peppers (see recipes on www.familycircle.com)
1: In a large pot bring broth and 3 cups water to a simmer.
2: In a second large heavy-bottom pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion; cook 3 minutes. Add garlic; cook 2 minutes.
3: Add rice to onion, stirring to evenly coat with the oil; cook 1 minute. Add wine and salt. Cook, stirring constantly until wine is absorbed, about 3 minutes.
4: Add 2 cups of the broth mixture to rice and stir until liquid is absorbed. Add remaining broth mixture, 1 cup at a time. Stir continuously until all the broth is absorbed before adding the next cup. Stir in corn after 20 minutes. All the broth mixture should be absorbed after about 25 to 30 minutes of cooking time. Stir in thawed corn during last 5 minutes of cooking. Remove 6 cups of risotto for use in Black Bean Risotto Cakes and Stuffed Peppers recipes in database. To the remaining 3 cups risotto, stir in the Parmesan cheese and parsley. Cover and keep warm.
5: In a large skillet heat oil. Add garlic and shrimp and season with the salt and pepper. Saute about 2 minutes per side.
6: Serve the risotto with the shrimp and half of the roasted carrots.
recipe_description: Corn adds a new dimension to risotto served with sauteed shrimp and roasted carrots for a satisfying meal that takes the guesswork out of dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  slices turkey bacon
1: 1/4 cup  light mayonnaise
2: 2  tablespoons  prepared basil pesto
3: 3/4 pound  U.S. farm-raised large shrimp (about 20), shelled and deveined
4: 8  slices light whole-wheat bread, toasted
5: 1  large tomato, thinly sliced
6: 4  large pieces of iceberg lettuce
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large nonstick skillet, cook the turkey bacon over medium-high heat until crisp, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper-towel-lined plate.
1: In a small measuring cup, mix together mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon of the pesto. Set aside.
2: Heat broiler. Place shrimp on a lightly greased broiler pan and brush with remaining 1 tablespoon pesto. Broil for 2 minutes per side. Remove to a plate and keep warm.
3: Spread each slice of toast with about 1-1/2 teaspoons of the pesto mayonnaise. Evenly distribute shrimp among 4 slices of the bread and top each with 2 slices of bacon, tomato and lettuce. Top each with the remaining bread slices.
recipe_description: Shrimp and a pesto mayonnaise spread are added to the traditional bacon, lettuce, and tomato sandwich. Purchase deveined shrimp to keep the preparation time at less than 30 minutes for this recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  salted dry roasted pistachio nuts, chopped
1: 1/2 cup  packed brown sugar
2: 3  tablespoons  lemon juice
3: 1  teaspoon  dried dillweed
4: 1  teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
5: 6  6  ounces  skinless salmon fillets
6: 1/4 cup  purchased basil pesto (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a small bowl combine pistachio nuts, brown sugar, lemon juice, dillweed, and pepper; set aside.
1: Place salmon fillets in a greased, foil-lined 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Measure thickness of fish. Spoon pistachio mixture evenly on each fillet. Gently press in place to form a crust.
2: Bake for 6 to 8 minutes for each 1/2-inch thickness of fish or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Pass pesto to serve with fish. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Salmon cooks quickly which means this healthy dinner will be ready in about 30 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  fresh or frozen skinless salmon fillet
1: 3/4 cup  finely chopped pecans
2: 1/2 cup  fine dry bread crumbs
3: 1/2- 1  teaspoon  ground black pepper
4: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
5: 1   egg
6: 2  tablespoons  water
7: 1/3 cup  all-purpose flour
8: 1/2 7  ounce jar roasted red sweet peppers (about 1/2 cup), drained
9: 1/4 cup  mayonnaise or salad dressing
10: 1  tablespoon  mango chutney, finely chopped
11: 1  tablespoon  lemon juice
12: 1/4 teaspoon  garlic salt
13: 1/8 teaspoon  ground red pepper
14: 2  tablespoons  cooking oil
recipe_name: Pecan Salmon with Sweet Pepper Mayo
recipe_instructions:
0: Thaw fish, if frozen. Rinse fish; pat dry with paper towels. Slice fish in half horizontally so that it is of nearly an even thickness (about 1/2 inch thick). Cut fish into 6 equal portions.
1: In a shallow dish combine pecans, bread crumbs, black pepper, and salt. In another dish beat together egg and water; place flour in a third dish. Coat each fish portion with flour, dip in egg mixture, and finally in pecan mixture. Place portions on a large plate; cover and chill for up to 30 minutes while preparing mayonnaise mixture.
2: For mayonnaise mixture, pat the drained, roasted peppers dry on paper towels; coarsely chop. In a small serving bowl stir together chopped peppers, mayonnaise or salad dressing, chutney, lemon juice, garlic salt, and ground red pepper. Set aside.
3: In a 12-inch nonstick skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add fish; cook for 3 minutes. Turn fish; cook for 3 to 4 minutes more or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. (Reduce heat as necessary during cooking to prevent overbrowning.) Serve with mayonnaise mixture. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Heart healthy salmon is coated with nuts and topped with flavored  mayonnaise to create a restaurant-style fish dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  fresh or frozen swordfish, shark, or tuna steaks, cut 1 inch thick
1: 1/2 cup  water
2: 2  tablespoons  white wine Worcestershire sauce or Worcestershire sauce
3: 1  teaspoon  cornstarch
4: 1/2- 1  teaspoon  grated gingerroot or 1/8 teaspoon ground ginger
5: 1/2 teaspoon  instant chicken bouillon granules
6: 1/8 teaspoon  onion powder
7: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
8: 3  cups  loose-pack frozen broccoli, carrots, water chestnuts, and red peppers, thawed and drained
9: 1  3  ounce can chow mein noodles or 1-1/2 cups hot cooked rice
recipe_instructions:
0: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Set aside.
1: For sauce, in a small bowl stir together the water, white wine Worcestershire sauce or Worcestershire sauce, cornstarch, gingerroot or ground ginger, chicken bouillon granules, and onion powder. Set aside.
2: Pour cooking oil into a wok or large skillet. (Add more oil as necessary during cooking.) Preheat over medium-high heat. Stir-fry the thawed vegetables for 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove the vegetables from the wok or skillet.
3: Add the fish to the hot wok or skillet. Stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or just till the fish begins to flake easily. Push fish from the center of the wok or skillet.
4: Stir sauce. Add sauce to the center of wok or skillet. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Return vegetables to the wok or skillet. Stir all ingredients together to coat with sauce. Cook and stir about 1 minute more or till heated through. Serve over chow mein noodles or hot rice. Makes 2 servings.
5: Complete your meal by serving cookies and scoops of ice cream.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  canola or vegetable oil
1: 1/4 cup  cherry preserves
2: 2  tablespoons  cider vinegar
3: 2  teaspoons  yellow mustard
4: 3   grilled salmon portions from Salmon Hobo Packs
5: 1   small pear, cored and coarsely chopped
6: 1   avocado, seeded, peeled, and chopped
7: 1/2 cup  sliced green onions (about 4)
8: 1/2 cup  honey-roasted almonds, coarsely chopped
9: 2  ounces  blue cheese, crumbled
10: Salt and pepper
11: 2  cups  spinach or arugula leaves, coarsely shredded
12: 4  10  inches  flour tortillas
13: Lemon and Lime Wedges
recipe_instructions:
0: In a blender container combine oil, cherry preserves, vinegar, and mustard; cover and blend until combined.
1: Flake salmon into large chunks. In a large bowl combine salmon, pear, avocado, green onions, nuts, and cheese; toss with preserve mixture to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
2: Serve with shredded spinach, folded tortillas, and lemon and lime wedges. Makes 4 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  large fresh or frozen shrimp with tails (about 7 ounces)
1: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded orange peel
2: 3  tablespoons  orange juice
3: 1  tablespoon  packed brown sugar
4: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh parsley
5: 1/4 teaspoon  ground ginger
6: 1 1/2 cups  shredded zucchini and/or yellow summer squash
7: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
8: 1/2 cup  finely chopped red sweet pepper (1 small)
9: 1/4 cup  finely chopped white onion
10: 1   egg, lightly beaten
11: 3  tablespoons  crushed multigrain saltine crackers
12: 1/8 teaspoon  garlic powder
13: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
14: 2  tablespoons  crumbled reduced-fat feta cheese (optional)
15: 1  recipe Dipping Sauce
16: 1/4 cup  plain fat-free Greek yogurt
17: 1  teaspoon  grated orange peel
18: 2 - 3  teaspoons  orange juice
19: 1/8 teaspoon  ground ginger
recipe_instructions:
0: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails intact if desired.
1: For marinade, in a medium bowl combine orange peel, orange juice, brown sugar, parsley, and ginger. Add shrimp; toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Drain shrimp, discarding marinade. Thread four shrimp onto each of two skewers,* leaving 1/4 inch between pieces.
2: Meanwhile, in a medium bowl combine zucchini and salt; let stand for 30 minutes. Drain excess liquid from zucchini. Stir in sweet pepper, onion, egg, crackers, and garlic powder.
3: For charcoal or gas grill, place skewers on the rack of a covered grill directly over medium heat. Grill for 5 to 8 minutes or until opaque, turning once. Remove from grill and keep warm.
4: In a very large nonstick skillet heat oil over medium heat. Spoon zucchini mixture into hot oil to form four mounds. Pressing down lightly with the back of a spoon, flatten each mound into a cake about 3 inches in diameter. Cook for 4 to 6 minutes or until golden brown, turning once halfway through cooking time.
5: To serve, place two fritters and a shrimp skewer on each of two serving plates. If desired, sprinkle feta cheese over fritters. Serve with Dipping Sauce.
6: In a small bowl whisk together yogurt, orange peel, orange juice, and ginger.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  teaspoons  olive oil
1: 2   fresh poblano chile peppers, stemmed, seeded, and thinly sliced*
2: 1/2  of a sweet onion, such as Vidalia, thinly sliced
3: 2  ounces  part-skim queso fresco, cut into small cubes
4: 2  tablespoons  Mexican crema or creme fraiche
5: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet heat oil over medium-low heat. Add peppers and onion; cook about 15 minutes or until onions are translucent.
1: Stir in queso fresco, crema, and salt; cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or until heated through. Serve as a side dish.
recipe_description: Chili peppers are delicious and a great source of vitamins and capsicum, a natural anti-inflammatory. I took my grandmother's traditional recipe, substituting olive oil for butter, cut the amount of cream in half and opted for skim milk cheese, lowering calories, fat and saturated fat. - Chef LaLa

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  teaspoons  light sour cream
1: 1  teaspoon  snipped fresh chives
2: 1/4 teaspoon  finely shredded lemon peel
3: 1  teaspoon  lemon juice
4: 1/2 teaspoon  honey
5: 1/3 cup  packaged shredded broccoli (broccoli slaw mix)
6: 2   hard-cooked eggs, sliced
7: 1  8 - 9  inch  low-carb whole wheat tortilla
8: 2  tablespoons  chopped, drained bottled roasted red sweet pepper
9: Ground black pepper (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small bowl, combine sour cream, chives, lemon peel, lemon juice, and honey. Add broccoli slaw; toss gently to coat. Cover and chill overnight. Wrap and chill egg slices overnight.
1: Spread broccoli mixture along the bottom edge of the tortilla, leaving a 1-1/2-inch space on both ends of the mixture. Top with roasted pepper and egg slices. Sprinkle with black pepper, if desired. Fold in sides of tortilla over filling. Starting from the bottom edge, roll up tortilla. Makes 1 serving

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3/4 cup  sugar
1: 1  envelope unflavored gelatin
2: 4  cups  whole milk
3: 4   eggs, beaten
4: 1  16  ounce package frozen unsweetened whole strawberries, partially thawed, or 4 cups fresh strawberries
5: 1  12  ounce package frozen lightly sweetened red raspberries or 3 cups fresh red raspberries
6: 1/2 cup  frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed
recipe_instructions:
0: Partially thaw frozen strawberries, if using. Mash strawberries slightly to break up; set aside.
1: In a large saucepan, combine sugar and gelatin. Stir in milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture just starts to boil. Remove from heat. Whisk about 1 cup of the hot mixture into beaten eggs; return all to saucepan. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer registers 175 degree F and mixture coats the back of a clean metal spoon. Do not boil. Stir in strawberries, raspberries, and orange juice concentrate. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. (Mixture will be very thick after chilling.)
2: Transfer the mixture to a 4- or 5-quart ice cream freezer; freeze according to the manufacturers directions. If desired, ripen. Makes about 2-1/2 quarts.
recipe_description: Frozen strawberries and raspberries team up in this sweet dessert for kids and diabetic. Only 1-carb-choice!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  chopped onion
1: 1 1/2 cups  chopped green sweet pepper
2: 1  14 1/2 ounce can tomatoes, cut up
3: 3/4 cup  bottled picante sauce or green salsa
4: 2  teaspoons  ground cumin
5: 2  cloves garlic, minced
6: 2  15  ounce cans black beans and/or red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
7: 12  6  inches  corn tortillas
8: 2  cups  shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese
9: 1  cup  chopped cherry or grape tomatoes
10: Chopped fresh cilantro, sliced green onions, and/or sliced pitted ripe olives
11: 1/2 cup  light sour cream or plain low-fat Greek yogurt (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet combine onion, sweet pepper, undrained tomatoes, picante sauce, cumin, and garlic. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Stir in beans.
1: Spread one-third of the bean mixture over the bottom of a 3-quart rectangular baking dish. Top with six of the tortillas, overlapping as necessary, and 1 cup of the cheese. Add another one-third of the bean mixture; top with remaining 6 tortillas and remaining bean mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
2: Bake, covered, in a 350 degrees  oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 10 minutes. Before serving, if desired, top with tomatoes and cilantro, green onions and/or olives. If you like, serve with sour cream.
recipe_description: This low-fat Tex-Mex recipe calls for bottled picante sauce, which is a less chunky salsa. For a twist, substitute salsa verde, a green salsa made with tomatillos and chile peppers.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2   Gala or Fuji apples
1: 1/2 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
2: 1  tablespoon  brown sugar
related_categories:
0: Apples
1: Fruit
2: Healthy Cooking
3: Healthy Snacks
recipe_instructions: 0: Heat the oven to 225 degrees . Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper. With a sharp knife or mandoline, thinly slice apples. (The thinner the slice, the crispier the chip.) Remove the seeds with a paring knife. Place the slices in a single layer on the prepared sheets. Stir together cinnamon and brown sugar. Sprinkle half the mixture onto the apples. Bake for 1 hour. Use tongs to flip the slices and sprinkle with the remaining cinnamon sugar. Bake for 1 hour more. Turn the oven off, but leave the apples inside for another hour to crisp. Let them cool, then store them in an air-tight container until ready to eat.
recipe_description: Sweet! These crispy apple chips have no added fat.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  boneless beef sirloin steak
1: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
2: 2  14  ounce can lower-sodium beef broth
3: 1  cup  water
4: 1  cup  bite-size strips carrot (2 medium)
5: 1/3 cup  long-grain rice
6: 1  tablespoon  grated fresh ginger
7: 3   cloves garlic, minced
8: 2  cups  coarsely chopped broccoli
9: 1/4 cup  sliced green onion (2)
10: 3  tablespoons  teriyaki sauce
11: 1  teaspoon  toasted sesame oil
12: 1/4 teaspoon  crushed red pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from beef. Cut beef into bite-size strips. In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in hot oil for 2 to 3 minutes or until beef is brown. Remove beef with a slotted spoon; set aside.
1: In the same skillet combine broth, water, carrot, uncooked rice, ginger, and garlic. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, 15 minutes or until the carrot and rice are tender.
2: Stir in beef, broccoli, green onion, teriyaki sauce, sesame oil, and red pepper. Simmer, covered, for 3 minutes. Makes 4 servings (6 cups).
recipe_description: The flavors and ingredients of a classic beef stir fry make up this low calorie main dish soup recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  3 - 4  pound  fresh beef brisket
1: 2  medium onions, thinly sliced and separated into rings
2: 1   bay leaf
3: 1  12  ounce can beer
4: 1/4 cup  chili sauce
5: 2  tablespoons  no-calorie, heat-stable granular sugar substitute
6: 1/2 teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
7: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
8: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
9: 1  clove garlic, minced
10: 2  tablespoons  cornstarch
11: 2  tablespoons  cold water
12: 10   Italian bread rolls
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from meat. If necessary, cut brisket to fit into a 3 1/2- to 6-quart slow cooker. Place the onions, bay leaf, and brisket in the cooker. In a medium bowl combine beer, chili sauce, sugar substitute, thyme, salt, pepper, and garlic; pour over meat.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 5 to 6 hours.
2: Using a slotted spoon, transfer brisket and onions to a serving platter; cover with foil to keep warm. Discard bay leaf.
3: For gravy, pour juices into a large measuring cup; skim fat. Measure 2 1/2 cups liquid; discard remaining liquid. In a medium saucepan stir together cornstarch and water; stir in the cooking liquid. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly; cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Serve meat on bread rolls topped with gravy. Makes 10 (3 1/2 ounces cooked meat, 1/4 cup gravy, and a 2-ounce bread roll) servings.
recipe_description: The flavorful gravymade from the beer-spiked cooking liquid--is the finishing touch to this tender meat dish.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   egg white
1: 1  tablespoon  water
2: 4  cups  raw whole cashews, whole almonds, walnut halves, and/or pecan halves
3: 3  tablespoons  packed brown sugar or brown sugar substitute* equivalent to 3 tablespoons brown sugar
4: 1  tablespoon  ground cumin
5: 2  teaspoons  chili powder
6: 1  teaspoon  garlic salt
7: 1/8 teaspoon  cayenne pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. In a medium bowl, combine egg white and the water; beat with a fork until frothy. Add nuts; toss to coat. Let stand for 5 minutes.
1: Meanwhile, in a large plastic bag, combine brown sugar, cumin, chili powder, garlic salt, and cayenne pepper. Add nuts; shake well to coat. Spread nuts evenly in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
2: Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until nuts are toasted and coating is dry, stirring twice. Transfer to a large sheet of foil. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  4 - 5  ounces  boneless beef chuck top blade (flat iron) steaks or cubed steaks, cut 1/2 inch thick
1: 1/3 cup  all-purpose flour
2: 1/2 teaspoon  Montreal or Kansas City steak seasoning
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/4 cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed
5: 2  tablespoons  fat-free milk
6: 1  cup  crushed cornflakes (2 cups whole flakes)
7: Nonstick cooking spray
8: 1  teaspoon  butter
9: 1/4 cup  finely chopped onion
10: 1   clove garlic, minced
11: 1  tablespoon  bourbon (optional)
12: 3/4 cup  fat-free milk
13: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
14: 1/4 teaspoon  Montreal or Kansas City steak seasoning
15: Freshly ground black pepper (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from steaks. If necessary, place each steak between two pieces of plastic wrap and pound lightly with the flat side of a meat mallet until 1/2 inch thick; remove plastic wrap.
1: In a shallow dish, combine 1/3 cup flour, 1/2 teaspoon steak seasoning, and salt. In another shallow dish, combine egg and 2 tablespoons milk. Place crushed cornflakes in a third shallow dish. Dip steaks into flour mixture, turning to coat evenly. Dip into egg mixture, then into cornflakes, turning to coat evenly.
2: Coat a very large nonstick skillet with cooking spray; heat skillet over medium-high heat. Add steaks to skillet. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes for medium-rare (145 degrees F) to medium (160 degrees F), turning once halfway through cooking. If steaks brown too quickly, reduce heat to medium. Remove steaks from skillet; cover and keep warm.
3: In the same skillet, heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add onion and garlic to skillet; cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring occasionally. If desired, add bourbon, stirring to scrape up any crusty browned bits. In a small bowl, whisk together 3/4 cup milk, 1 tablespoon flour, and 1/4 teaspoon steak seasoning until smooth. Add all at once to onion mixture. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more.
4: Serve steaks with gravy. If desired, sprinkle with pepper.
recipe_description: The key to ensuring that the coating gets crispy is to use a very large nonstick skillet so all the steak pieces fit in a single layer.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  12.3 ounce package light firm silken-style tofu (fresh bean curd)
1: 1/2 cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed, or 2 eggs
2: 3  ounces  cheddar-flavored soy cheese, finely shredded (3/4 cup)
3: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh basil
4: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
5: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
6: 2  teaspoons  olive oil
7: 1 1/2 cups  sliced fresh assorted mushrooms (such as cremini, stemmed shiitake, morel, and/or button)
8: 12  ounces  fresh asparagus spears, trimmed and cut into 1-inch-long pieces
9: 1/4 cup  finely chopped shallots
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a blender or food processor, combine tofu and eggs. Cover and blend or process just until combined. Transfer to a large bowl; stir in soy cheese, 1 tablespoon of the basil, the pepper, and salt. Set aside.
1: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, asparagus, and shallots. Cook and stir for 5 to 8 minutes or just until tender; cool slightly. Stir vegetable mixture into tofu mixture, stirring until well mixed.
2: Divide mixture among six 6-ounce ramekins or au gratin dishes. Place filled ramekins in a 15101-inch baking pan.
3: Bake, uncovered, about 20 minutes or until set and edges are bubbly. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon basil. Serve warm.
recipe_description: Tofu and soy cheese boost the protein in these mini vegetable-and-egg casseroles. Serve them for brunch or a weekend breakfast.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  teaspoon  unflavored gelatin
1: 1/3 cup  peach nectar or apricot nectar
2: 2  6 - 8  ounces  cartons vanilla or peach fat-free yogurt with sweetener
3: 1/3 26  ounce  jar refrigerated mango slices, drained, or one 8-ounce can peach slices, drained
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small saucepan combine the unflavored gelatin and peach or apricot nectar. Let stand for 5 minutes. Cook and stir over medium heat until gelatin is dissolved.
1: In a blender container combine gelatin mixture, yogurt, and drained mango or peach slices. Cover and blend until smooth. Spoon mixture into eight 3-ounce paper cups. Cover each cup with foil. Cut a small slit in the center of each foil cover and insert a rounded wooden stick into each. Freeze pops for 4 to 6 hours or until firm.
2: To serve, remove the foil and tear paper cups away from pops. Makes 8 pops.
recipe_description: Made with real fruit and fat-free yogurt, these pops are a healthful low-calorie treat.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  medium carrot, cut into large chunks
1: 1  medium russet potato, cut into large chunks
2: 1  medium parsnip or  turnip, peeled and cut into large chunks
3: 1  small onion, quartered
4: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
5: 1  tablespoon  balsamic vinegar
6: 1   Cornish game hen or poussin (about 1-1/2 pounds)
7: 2  cloves garlic, minced
8: 2  teaspoons  snipped fresh rosemary or 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
9: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
10: 1/8 teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
11: Fresh rosemary or sage leaves (optional)
12: Pear-shaped cherry tomatoes (optional)
recipe_name: Cornish Game Hen with Roasted Root Vegetables
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine carrot, potato, parsnip or turnip, and onion. Add oil and balsamic vinegar; toss to lightly coat. Spread in a 9x9x2-inch baking pan; cover with foil. Roast for 30 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F.
1: Meanwhile, gently separate the skin from the hen breast and tops of drumsticks by easing a paring knife or your fingers between the skin and the meat to make 2 pockets that extend all the way down to the neck cavity and over the drumsticks. In a small bowl, combine garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Set aside 1 teaspoon of the fresh rosemary mixture (1/2 teaspoon if using dried rosemary). Rub remaining rosemary mixture under the skin onto the breast and drumsticks. Using 100%-cotton string, tie drumsticks to tail; tie wing tips to body. Sprinkle the reserved rosemary mixture on the skin. Uncover vegetables. Add hen to baking pan.
2: Roast hen and vegetables, uncovered, for 1 to 1-1/4 hours or until vegetables are tender and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thigh of the hen registers 180 degrees F (the thermometer should not touch the bone), stirring vegetables once or twice.  Remove string. Cover with foil; let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
3: If desired, garnish with fresh rosemary or sage leaves and tomatoes. To serve hen, use kitchen shears or a long heavy knife to carefully cut hen in half lengthwise.  Remove skin and discard. Serve with vegetables. Makes 2 (1/2 of the game hen and 1 1/4 cup vegetables).
recipe_description: Balsamic vinegar lends a subtly sweet accent to the roasted vegetables in this recipe while garlic and rosemary boost the flavor of the tender, juicy game hen. To round out the meal, toss some salad greens with your favorite salad dressing.

recipe_ingredients:

2: 1/2 cup  water
3: 1/2 cup  spicy brown mustard
4: 4  teaspoons  fajita seasoning

recipe_instructions:
0: Lightly coat a large skillet with cooking spray. Heat skillet over medium-high; add stir-fry strips. Cook and stir until brown. Drain off fat.
1: In a 1-1/2-quart slow cooker stir together water, mustard, and fajita seasoning. Add stir-fry strips, stirring to coat.
2: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 to 7 hours. If no heat setting is available, cook for 6 to 7 hours. Using a slotted spoon, transfer meat to a cutting board. Discard cooking liquid. Using two forks, pull meat apart into shreds.
3: Divide meat mixture evenly among the warmed tortillas. Top with sweet pepper strips and, if desired, cilantro and/or green onion. Roll up tortillas. Using a serrated knife, cut filled tortillas crosswise into bite-size pieces. If desired, skewer with decorative toothpicks.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1  tablespoon  olive oil

3: 1  cup  coarsely chopped onion

recipe_instructions:
0: Rinse beans. Place beans in a large saucepan or Dutch oven. Add enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover; let stand for 1 hour.
1: Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add half of the meat and the onion; cook and stir until meat is brown. Transfer to a 3 1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker using a slotted spoon. Repeat with remaining meat. Stir tomato sauce, undrained tomatoes, broth, chipotle peppers and adobo sauce, oregano, and cumin into mixture in slow cooker. Drain and rinse the beans; stir into mixture in cooker.
2: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 5 to 6 hours. Top individual servings with sweet pepper and cilantro. Makes 8 (1-cup) servings.
recipe_description: This chunky Mexican-style beef stew recipe owes its flavor to an intriguing blend of chipotle pepper, oregano, cumin, and cilantro.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1/2 cup  sliced almonds
2: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine, melted
3: 1/2 teaspoon  apple pie spice
4: salt
5: 1  cup  dried cherries and/or golden raisins
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. In a 15x10x1-inch baking pan, combine cereal and almonds. In a small bowl, stir together melted butter, apple pie spice, and salt. Drizzle butter mixture over cereal mixture; toss to coat evenly.
1: Bake about 20 minutes or until almonds are toasted, stirring once during baking. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 20 minutes. Stir in dried cherries or raisins. Cool completely. Store in a tightly covered container at room temperature for up to 1 week.  Makes 5 cups, 20 (1/4-cup) servings.
recipe_description: Oat cereal, almonds, and dried cherries in this recipe team up for a tempting snack that will fit right in to your diabetic meal plan.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 2 1/2 teaspoons  kosher salt
2: 2  tablespoons  Dijon mustard
3: 1  tablespoon  minced garlic
4: 1/3 cup  heavy cream
5: 1/3 cup  prepared horseradish
6: 1/4 cup  cognac
7: 1  14  ounce can low-sodium beef broth
8: 2  teaspoons  whole pink peppercorns, coarsely crushed, plus more for garnish
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Healthy Cooking
2: Low Carb
3: Prime Rib
recipe_instructions:
0: Place rib roast, fat side up, in a roasting pan and let stand at room temperature 1 hour.
1: Heat oven to 450 degrees F and place rack in center. Sprinkle roast with 2 teaspoons salt. Combine mustard and garlic; evenly spread over top of roast and season with black pepper.
2: Roast 20 minutes, then reduce temperature to 325 degrees F. Roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted in center by 2 inches (without touching bone) registers 125 degrees  to 130 degrees F for medium-rare (loosely tenting with foil if top browns too quickly), about 2-1/2 hours. Transfer to a cutting board, tent with foil and let stand 15 minutes before carving. (Internal temperature will rise 5 to 10 degrees.) Reserve pan and juices.
3: Meanwhile, for Creamed Horseradish, whisk cream in a medium bowl until thickened but not yet holding soft peaks, 1 to 2 minutes. Gently fold in horseradish and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt; season with black pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl; chill 30 minutes or up to 1 hour.
4: For pan sauce, pour pan juices into a fat separator; drain off fat. Add cognac and 1/2 cup broth to roasting pan. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, scraping up any browned bits with a spoon. Simmer until liquid has almost evaporated, about 8 minutes. Add remaining broth, the pan juices and peppercorns; simmer 2 minutes more. Transfer to a gravy boat.
5: Cut twine from roast, remove bone and transfer meat to a cutting board; garnish with peppercorns, if desired. Serve sauce and Creamed Horseradish on the side.
recipe_description: Mustard and garlic coat the rib roast as it cooks. The flavored beef goes perfectly with the heavy cream and horseradish dip in this elegant dinner.

recipe_ingredients:

recipe_name: Toasted Seeds with Golden Berry and Cocoa Nibs
recipe_instructions:

1: Transfer pumpkin seeds to a large bowl. Stir in golden berries, cocoa nibs, sea salt, and pepper.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  cloves garlic, crushed

7: 8   firm or crisp Italian rolls
recipe_instructions:
0: Combine garlic and pepper. Rub evenly over roast. Place roast, fat side up, on a rack in a roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer. Roast, uncovered, in a 325 degree F oven for 1-1/2 to 2 hours or until thermometer registers 145 degree F (medium rare).
1: Transfer to a platter. Cool for 30 minutes. Cover; refrigerate until chilled. Reserve pan juices; chill separately.
2: Meanwhile, skim fat from drippings; discard fat. Pour drippings into a Dutch oven. Stir in water, bouillon granules, and crushed red pepper. Bring to boiling. Add green pepper strips; reduce heat and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes or until green peppers are crisp-tender. With a slotted spoon, remove green pepper strips; keep warm.
3: With a very sharp knife or electric knife, slice meat very thin. Add to broth mixture and heat through.
4: Split rolls horizontally. Place on a plate. Spoon some of the broth over each half. Arrange beef on bottom half. Place pepper strips over beef; cover with top half of roll. Serve with individual dishes of broth mixture for dipping. Makes 8 sandwiches.

Add the eggplant, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and stir occasionally until browned and tender, about 15 minutes. (The meat should render enough fat to cook the eggplant, but if the pan seems dry, add another tablespoon or two of oil).

2: When the pasta is done, drain it and toss with the eggplant mixture and the Parmesan. Taste and adjust the seasoning, garnish with basil if you like, and serve.

recipe_ingredients:

recipe_instructions:

1: Cook the sausage in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it's well browned, stirring often to break up the meat. Remove the sausage from the skillet.  Pour off any fat.

recipe_ingredients:

3: 8  ounces  small whole fresh mushrooms
4: 3  medium red and/or yellow sweet peppers, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces

6: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
7: 1/8 teaspoon  black pepper
8: 1  14  ounce can chicken broth
9: 3/4 cup  milk
10: 1/2 cup  shredded Swiss cheese (2 oz.)

12: 2  slices sourdough bread, cut into cubes (about 1-1/2 cups)
13: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
14: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh parsley
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Remove meat from chicken; discard bones. Cut chicken pieces in chunks to equal 3 cups. Save remaining chicken for another use.
1: In Dutch oven cook spaghetti according to package directions. Add asparagus the last 1 minute of cooking. Drain. Return to pan.
2: Meanwhile, in large skillet cook mushrooms and sweet peppers in hot butter over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in flour and black pepper until well combined. Add broth and milk all at once. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.
3: Add mushroom mixture, chicken pieces, Swiss cheese, and half the lemon peel to pasta mixture in Dutch oven. Toss gently to coat. Spoon pasta mixture into a 13x9x2-inch baking dish or 3-quart rectangular casserole.
4: In a medium bowl toss together bread cubes, olive oil, and remaining lemon peel. Spread bread cube mixture on pasta mixture. Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Makes 10 (1-cup) servings.
recipe_description: The original dish was created in 1908 in San Francisco in honor of opera star Luisa Tetrazzini.Once the ingredients are mixed together, including chicken, asparagus, spaghetti, and mushrooms, the all-in-one casserole recipe bakes in just 15 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1 1/2 cups  broccoli flowerets
2: 1   large carrot, thinly sliced
3: 1/4 cup  white wine vinegar

9: 1   medium red or yellow sweet pepper, cut into thin strips

1: Meanwhile, for dressing, in a screw-top jar combine the vinegar, oil, Italian seasoning, mustard, black pepper, and garlic powder. Cover and shake well. Set aside.
2: In a large bowl combine the pasta mixture and sweet pepper. Shake dressing. Pour the dressing over pasta mixture; toss gently to coat.
recipe_description: This meatless main dish salad is ready to eat in fewer than 25 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:

1: Cover and cook on Low heat setting 6 to 7 hours.
2: Remove turkey from cooker. Stir rice and oregano into vegetable mixture; return turkey to cooker. Cover and cook on Low heat setting about 1 hour or until rice is tender.
3: Remove turkey from cooker. Stir cheese into rice mixture until melted. Serve with turkey.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6  slices bacon, chopped
1: 1   boneless pork roast (2 pounds), trimmed of fat and cut into 1-inch cubes
2: 1  medium onion, chopped

9: 2  cans (15 ounces each) butter beans, drained and rinsed

recipe_instructions:

1: Add pork, onion, salt, pepper and Italian seasoning to pot, cooking 4 minutes, until pork is no longer pink. Stir in kielbasa and cook 2 minutes more.
2: Increase heat to medium-high and add wine. Simmer 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and continue to simmer 3 minutes. Stir in beans; heat through, about 1 minute. Serve warm.
recipe_description: Dinner will be ready in 30 minutes when this pork and bean stew is on the menu. Crispy bacon and Italian seasoning adds flavor to this recipe; kielbasa adds a hint of spice.

recipe_ingredients:
